description: Black and Hispanic women and those without bachelors degrees are at risk of being left further behind as the economy slowly begins to recover.

title: A Novel of the West Spans Decades and Genres
description: WE BEGIN AT THE ENDBy Chris Whitaker

title: What Does Toxic Stress Do to Children?
description: Dr. Nadine Burke Harriss pioneering work on how childhood trauma shapes adult outcomes led to her being named the first surgeon general of California. That was in 2019. And then, of course, the novel coronavirus hit. The job of Californias surgeon general in 2020 was not what it was in 2019. But in some ways, Burke Harriss expertise was more necessary than ever.

title: Welcome to the Family. Good Luck Fitting In.
description: THE FOURTH CHILDBy Jessica Winter

title: Forgetting Doesnt Kill You, but It Sure Feels Like It
description: MY HEARTBy Semezdin MehmedinovicTranslated by Celia Hawkesworth

title: Can Walking on Eggshells Have a Healing Effect? Maybe.
description: BROODBy Jackie Polzin

title: What Are Your Reactions to Oprahs Interview With Harry and Meghan?
description: Were you among the 17.1 million viewers of Oprah Winfreys interview with Prince Harry and his wife, Meghan? If so, how much did you already know about the couple and their break with the British royal family last year? What parts of the interview stood out for you?

title: Stories of War and Its Aftermath, From Ancient Greece to America in 2034
description: 2034A Novel of the Next World WarBy Elliot Ackerman and Adm. James Stavridis303 pp. Penguin Press. $27.

title: Short Story Collections for an Ever-Changing World
description: REALITY AND OTHER STORIESBy John Lanchester178 pp. Norton. $26.95.

title: A Family Reunites in Beirut, Where the Past Is Never Past
description: THE ARSONISTS CITYBy Hala Alyan

title: Looking for Sexual Healing?
description: BOOM CHICKA BOOM CHICKA WAH WAH. A-BOOM CHICKA BOOM CHICKA WAH  Its time for sex!

title: Meet Three New Voices on the Fiction Front
description: THE KINDEST LIEBy Nancy Johnson336 pp. Morrow. $27.99.

title: For a Former Addict, Recovery Brings Only Temporary Relief
description: MODEL CITIZEN A Memoir By Joshua Mohr

title: Amazon and the Breaking of Baltimore
description: When I set out to report a book on the problem of growing regional inequality in America, I did not expect that it would involve spending several hours on a cold winter day standing inside a large dumpster.

title: The Pandemic Economy and the Rise of the Noxious Contract
description: For far too many American workers, the pandemic has delivered a one-two punch of hardship. The American Voices Project, a national study of the ongoing crisis brought on by the coronavirus, recently interviewed a 26-year-old essential worker about the pandemics first punch: I was working at a gas station, bringing home enough to get me by, she said. And then the Corona hit, my hours got cut, I was only working one or two days, sometimes no days, and then I was out of a job. It literally was hell  I was suffocating in bills.

title: A Smarter App Is Watching Your Wallet
description: This article is part of our new series, Currents, which examines how rapid advances in technology are transforming our lives.

title: The G.O.P. Isnt Going to Split Apart Anytime Soon
description: There is no rule that says American political parties cant die, and there was a time when it was quite common.

title: Why Japan Is Holding Back as the World Rushes Toward Electric Cars
description: TOKYO  Just over a decade ago, Nissan became the first automaker to offer a mass-produced car that ran on batteries alone. That hatchback, the Leaf, has been a smash hit, at least by electric car standards, with more than 500,000 sold by the end of last year.

title: Pandemic Forces F.D.A. to Sharply Curtail Drug Company Inspections
description: The Covid-19 pandemic has forced the Food and Drug Administration to postpone hundreds of drug company inspections, creating an enormous backlog that is delaying new drug approvals and leading the industry to warn of impending shortages of existing medicines.

title: Elderly, Vaccinated and Still Lonely and Locked Inside
description: TORONTO  Devora Greenspon is among the lucky ones. She is one of the 1.4 percent of Canadians who has received two shots of a coronavirus vaccine. So have 90 percent of the residents in her nursing home.

title: Dont Count Out the Cloth Coat
description: In his nationally televised Checkers speech of 1952, Richard Nixon, a vice-presidential candidate at the time, aggressively hoisted his Everyman flag. Pat doesnt have a mink coat, he famously said of his wife, but she does have a respectable Republican cloth coat.

title: How Biden Is Trying to Help Working-Class Voters in Red-State Alabama
description: BESSEMER, Ala.  The first time Darryl Richardson tried to start a union, he was 23 years old and virtually alone in the effort. It failed, he lost his job, and he remembers the lasting fears of other employees who worried they would suffer a similar fate.

title: His Sister Renovated His Chicago Apartment (Twice)
description: It can take more than one renovation to get things just right, as one Chicago designer and her brother discovered.

title: How Many Renovations Does It Take to Get Things Just Right?
description: Creating a home that suits you isnt easy. It takes time, trial and error  and sometimes more than one renovation.

title: I Was So Nervous: Back to Class After a Year Online
description: CHICAGO  Maisie Robinson was so excited for her first day of kindergarten that she woke up at 2:30 a.m. to make her family breakfast.

title: The Arsonists City, by Hala Alyan: An Excerpt
description: Tonight the man will die. In some ways, the city already seems resigned to it, the Beirut dusk uncharacteristically flat, cloudy, a peculiar staleness rippling through the trees like wind. Its easy to costume the earth for grief, and tonight the birds perched upon the tangled electricity wires look like mourners in their black and white feathers, staring down at the concrete refugee camps without song.

title: The Return of High Schools in New York City
description: [Want to get New York Today by email? Heres the sign-up.]

title: The pandemic has forced the F.D.A. to sharply curtail drug company inspections.
description: The pandemic has forced the Food and Drug Administration to postpone hundreds of drug company inspections, creating an enormous backlog that is delaying new drug approvals and leading the industry to warn of impending shortages of existing medicines.

title: A Safety Net for American Children
description: Even as recently as a year ago, even the most cleareyed analysts thought it was a long shot. But this week, a child tax credit is expected to be passed into law, as part of the economic stimulus bill.

title: Taking on Child Poverty
description: Twenty-two years ago, Prime Minister Tony Blair announced an ambitious plan to fight child poverty in Britain. At the time, more than 25 percent of British children lived in poverty.

title: Bitcoins Climate Problem
description: Bitcoin uses more electricity per transaction than any other method known to mankind, and so its not a great climate thing.

title: Hunting for a Leftover Vaccine? This Site Will Match You With a Clinic.
description: In the hustle to score an elusive vaccine appointment, the leftover dose has become the stuff of pandemic lore.

title: 2 Days, 10 Dogs, 150 Miles in the Wilderness: This Is the Iditarod for Teens
description: BIG LAKE, Alaska  When Morgan Martens, 14, stepped off his sled at the Junior Iditarod finish line after 16 hours 40 minutes 20 seconds of mushing, his grin was barely visible beneath his warm layers.

title: Palace Breaks Silence on Meghan and Harry Interview, Saying Whole Family Is Saddened
description: LONDON  Buckingham Palace broke nearly 48 hours of silence Tuesday about a bombshell interview with Prince Harry and Meghan, Duchess of Sussex, saying the whole royal family is saddened and expressing concern about the issue of racism the couple had raised.

title: The Long, Sad Decline of Mark Pavelich, a Miracle on Ice Star
description: Mark Pavelich appeared to be doing well in recent weeks.

title: BP and other oil giants are betting big on being able to bury pollutants under the ocean.
description: Lots of attention is being paid to carbon capture as a way to meet the targets in the 2016 Paris climate agreement. The idea sounds deceptively simple: Divert pollutants before they can escape into the air, and bury them deep in the ground where they can do no harm.

title: Restaurants are trying to improve the drive-through experience as orders soar.
description: The basic experience of sitting in a single line of cars, speaking into a sometimes garbled intercom and pulling up to a window to pay for your food before driving away is poised to be demonstrably altered for the first time in decades, Julie Creswell reports for The New York Times.

title: U.S. Growth Could Surge on Stimulus and Vaccine Rollout
description: PARIS  The U.S. economy will accelerate twice as fast as expected this year as the coming passage of President Bidens $1.9 trillion stimulus plan, combined with a rapid vaccine rollout, ignites a powerful recovery from the pandemic and helps lift global growth, the Organization for Economic Cooperation and Development said on Tuesday.

title: Weekly News Quiz for Students: Dr. Seuss, Vaccine Timeline, Royal Interview
description: Have you been paying attention to the news recently? See how many of these 10 questions you can get right.

title: Nine Tools for Better, Longer Sleep
description: For many of us, a restful night of sleep is hard to come by under the best of circumstances. But against the backdrop of a long, cold winter and the ongoing pandemic, it can feel almost impossible. While there will always be newfangled gadgets that claim to solve your sleep problems with advanced technology  yes, there are such things as sleep robots and sleep-tracking rings  newer doesnt always mean better. Wirecutter, the New York Times Company that reviews and recommends products, has tested countless items to find real, proven solutions, from blackout curtains and sleep masks to better pillows and white-noise machines.

title: Catalan Separatist Leader Loses Immunity, Clearing Way for Spains Extradition Bid
description: MADRID  The European Parliament has stripped the immunity of Carles Puigdemont, the former separatist leader of Catalonia, clearing the way for Spain to make a fresh attempt to extradite him from Belgium and try him on sedition charges.

title: Why Bill Gates Is Worried About Bitcoin
description: Bitcoin is continuing to climb  its price is now above $54,000, giving it a market cap of more than $1 trillion  and draw more fans in corporate America. But skeptics are increasingly asking whether its worth the huge environmental cost, Andrew writes in his latest column.

title: Transcript: Ezra Klein Interviews Nadine Burke Harris
description: Every Tuesday and Friday, Ezra Klein invites you into a conversation about something that matters, like todays episode with Nadine Burke Harris.  Listen wherever you get your podcasts.

title: Lawsuit Challenging N.Y.C. School Segregation Targets Gifted Programs
description: A major new lawsuit filed Tuesday could force fundamental changes to how New York Citys public school students are admitted into selective schools, and marked the latest front in a growing political, activist and now legal movement to confront inequality in the nations largest school system.

title: The Lonely Death of George Bell
description: Dying alone can cause a surprising amount of activity. Sometimes, along the way, a lifes secrets are revealed.

title: A Conversation on Passing
description: T Book Club consists of a series of articles and discussions dedicated to classic works of American literature. Here, our third (virtual) event, on the topic of Nella Larsens novel Passing, featuring the writer Brit Bennett in conversation with T features director Thessaly La Force, and taking place at 7 p.m. E.S.T. on March 9.

title: Recent Commercial Real Estate Transactions
description: $2.095 MILLION

title: How LeBron James Uses His Influence to Improve Community Development
description: AKRON, Ohio  Professional sports stars often use their prominence to influence public opinion and advocate change, including in real estate development. One standout is LeBron James, the Los Angeles Lakers forward and four-time National Basketball Association champion.

title: A Conversation With Gray Davis
description: Good morning.

title: New & Noteworthy, From Vivian Gornicks Essays to No-Recipe Recipes
description: I HAD A MISCARRIAGE: A Memoir, a Movement, by Jessica Zucker. (Feminist Press, paper, $18.95.) The author, a psychologist specializing in maternal mental health, struggled after her own pregnancy ended in miscarriage; this memoir seeks to destigmatize the issue.

title: Maker of Dove Soap Will Drop the Word Normal From Beauty Products
description: The beauty and personal-care company Unilever said on Tuesday that it would no longer use the word normal on its products or in its advertising, after a study revealed that it makes most people feel excluded.

title: After 80 Years, Still Smiling on the Job
description: Fred Marcus, who was a longtime wedding photographer in New York, often said: When the wedding is over the photographs will last forever. So will the relationships we made at that event.

title: Blindness Sets Opening, Off Broadway and Indoors
description: An immersive audio adaptation of Jos Saramagos dystopian novel Blindness will be among the first productions to open in New York City since the coronavirus pandemic shuttered theaters a year ago.

title: I Miss Being Part of an Audience
description: Last month, I walked through the lobby of a comedy club and started to make small talk with a neon jellyfish. This may sound like a trippy, pandemic-induced dream, but its actually the latest experiment in live entertainment online.

title: Jackie Brown and Tangerine Dream: What I Care a Lot Is Made Of
description: Rosamund Pike recently earned a Golden Globe for her portrayal of the cunning, utterly amoral Marla Grayson in the Netflix thriller I Care a Lot. Marla shrewdly, confidently games the system to con elderly folks out of their savings  until her latest victims son (Peter Dinklage) starts paying close attention. It is a dagger of a performance that is of a piece with the writer-director J Blakesons film, a slick, savage caper dominated by bold visual and sonic choices, and humor as black as Marlas outfits are bright.

title: Laws used to fight pandemic are in some cases weakening democracies, report says.
description: The coronavirus pandemic has weakened democracy across Europe, according to a human rights group that looked into 14 countries. On Tuesday, the group warned against increasing threats to journalists, limits on freedom to protest, and the weakening independence of the judicial systems, among other developments.

title: Nomadland and Rocks Lead Diverse BAFTA Nominations
description: LONDON  Nomadland, Chlo Zhaos drama about a middle-aged woman who travels across the United States in a van seeking itinerant work, scored the biggest number of high-profile nominations for this years EE British Academy Film Awards, Britains equivalent of the Oscars.

title: How Meghan Markle Has Already Changed the Way We Talk About Suicide
description: To many people, suicide is unspeakable. Even mental health professionals sometimes do verbal gymnastics to avoid saying the word.

title: Complaints of Emotional Abuse Roil Synchronized Swimming
description: A few years after competing in synchronized swimming at the 2012 London Olympics, Szofi Kiss of Hungary began working with a coach from Russia, whom she would identify only by her first name as Natalia. The coach, Kiss said, separated some members of her training group into what she called the Chubby Team, sometimes withheld dinner from them and told them, You disgust me, and Im nauseous looking at you, when the swimmers exited the pool after workouts.

title: One Novel. Three Generations. All of Lifes Challenges and Joys.
description: THE RECENT EASTBy Thomas Grattan

title: Boeing sold more planes than were canceled last month as it regains its footing.
description: Boeing said on Tuesday that it sold 31 airplanes in February after accounting for cancellations, the first month in more than a year that the aerospace giant had positive sales, suggesting that it is starting to regain its footing after the 737 Max crisis.

title: A New Writer for Superman
description: When the Brian Michael Bendis run on Superman and Action Comics ended (the last issue he wrote came out in December), readers wondered who the next writer would be. Not many would have predicted Phillip Kennedy Johnson would be the one.

title: Yearly Lung Cancer Scans Are Advised for People 50 and Over With Shorter Smoking Histories
description: New guidelines from medical experts will nearly double the number of people in the United States who are advised to have yearly CT scans to screen for lung cancer, and will include many more African-Americans and women than in the past.

title: Epoch Media Casts Wider Net to Spread Its Message Online
description: Youmaker, a little-known video site, prominently featured a video alleging that a far-left extremist movement was plotting to destroy America.

title: Unlocking the Mysteries of Long COVID
description: A growing number of clinicians are on an urgent quest to find treatments for a frighteningly pervasive problem. Theyve had surprising early success.

title: R.N.C. says it has every right to use Trumps name to raise money but wont do so without his OK.
description: The Republican National Committee on Monday rebuffed a cease-and-desist letter from former President Donald J. Trump that warned it not to use his name or likeness to raise money from donors.

title: What Will Your After Look Like?
description: UPDATE: We are no longer accepting submissions.

title: Teen Vogue Staff Members Condemn Editors Decade-Old, Racist Tweets
description: [Read more on Teen Vogue editor resigning]

title: Move Over, Nerds. Its the Politicians Economy Now.
description: American political leaders have learned a few things in the last 12 years, since the nation last tried to claw its way out of an economic hole.

title: Is Humility, Not Righteousness, the Key to Persuasion?
description: To the Editor:

title: New York will allow anyone over 60 to get vaccinated starting Wednesday.
description: New York will lower its age threshold for Covid-19 vaccine eligibility beginning on Wednesday, allowing anyone older than 60 to be inoculated, Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo announced on Tuesday.

title: Norton Juster, Who Wrote The Phantom Tollbooth, Dies at 91
description: Norton Juster, who wrote one of childrens literatures most beloved and enduring books, The Phantom Tollbooth, died on Monday at his home in Northampton, Mass. He was 91.

title: For a Preview of What the N.C.A.A. Hopes to Pull Off, Look to Las Vegas
description: Of all the anomalous protocols, strategies and workarounds that have been put in place to stage the N.C.A.A. basketball tournaments during the pandemic, consider what Las Vegass McCarran International Airport might look like this weekend with charter jets lined up on the tarmac like cabs outside a La Guardia taxi stand.

title: Taylor Swift and the Wisdom of Youth
description: To hear more audio stories from publishers like The New York Times, download Audm for iPhone or Android.

title: Kux, From the Toloache Team, Opens in Greenwich Village
description: In redoing one of his Toloache locations, the chef and restaurateur Julian Medina and his business partner, Louis Skibar, have given culinary voice to their staff. The menu features a snapshot of home cooking from about 10 cooks, many from the Puebla, Mexico, area, with dishes like tacos de birria, tostadas, various moles, and steamed cod in banana leaf. The cooks offer personal background: Victor Lopez said his enfrijoladas and sopa de fideos with angel hair pasta remind him of his mother, and Yuliani Palafox recalled her mother and grandmother frying spices and nuts for mole poblano. As for drinks, in addition to tequilas and mezcals, there will be raicilla and sotol, a spirit from northern Mexico. Its combined with aperol, prickly pear, lime and agave in a cocktail called La Dasy. The restaurant, in neutral tones brightened with Mexican art, is on two levels with 44 seats at 35 percent capacity. Seven heated cabanas outdoors accommodate up to 28. (Opens Wednesday)

title: How Americas Vaccine System Makes People With Health Problems Fight for a Place in Line
description: As states have begun vaccinating Americans with medical conditions that may raise their risk for a severe case of Covid-19, they are setting widely varying rules about which conditions to prioritize.

title: Park Avenue Armory Announces an In-Person Spring Season
description: Live, in-person performances will return to Park Avenue Armory on March 24, the Armory announced on Tuesday. Social Distance Hall, a season of commissioned works for reduced capacity audiences, will open with Afterwardsness, by the Bill T. Jones/Arnie Zane Company, followed by projects by Steven Hoggett, Christine Jones and David Byrne; and Laurie Anderson and Jason Moran.

title: Google and Facebook Killed Free
description: This article is part of the On Tech newsletter. You can sign up here to receive it weekdays.

title: Fully vaccinated people in the U.S. now have more guidance from the C.D.C. on activities. That doesnt yet include travel.
description: When the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention announced new freedoms for the fully-vaccinated members of the population, questions about traveling to visit grandchildren, for example, were immediate.

title: Jimmy Carter is disheartened, saddened and angry by the G.O.P. push to curb voting rights in Georgia.
description: Former President Jimmy Carter  a one-term Georgia governor who first ran for office in the 1960s  said efforts by Republicans in the state to restrict ballot access represented an attempt to turn back the clock on hard-won progress in empowering disenfranchised voters.

title: France Eases Access, a Little, to Its Secrets
description: PARIS  President Emmanuel Macron of France on Tuesday announced that the declassification of secret archives more than 50 years old would be accelerated, a move that will facilitate access to documents related to the Algerian War  a controversial chapter of Frances history that authorities have long been reluctant to face.

title: I Sang Through Labor to Manage the Pain
description: Back in the summer of 2016, when I was about to give birth and enduring one debilitating contraction after another, I was struck with an idea: What if I were to sing through the agony?

title: Your Wednesday Briefing
description: The military and its brutal practices have been on the global stage since a coup last month. The generals are now fully back in charge, and the Tatmadaw, as the military is known, has turned its guns on the masses, who have mounted a nationwide civil disobedience movement.

title: A Model and Her Norman Rockwell Meet Again
description: Charlotte Sorenson was riffling through a newspaper one morning in December when she recognized someone in a gallery advertisement for a Norman Rockwell painting that she had not seen in years: herself.

title: Directors Guild Nominations Make History With Two Female Contenders
description: The Directors Guild of America announced its feature-film nominees on Monday that included more than one woman in the top directing category for the first time in the guilds 72-year history.

title: Inside a Billionaires Plan to Influence New Yorks Mayoral Race
description: The billionaire developer Stephen M. Ross is rallying fellow business leaders to commit tens of millions of dollars in an effort to push moderate Democrats to vote in the June mayoral primary in New York and change the future course of the city.

title: Looming Deadline and Last-Minute Changes Hinder P.P.P. Loans
description: The latest revision of the Paycheck Protection Program appeared to be a victory for the most vulnerable small businesses, offering more generous relief to companies like solo ventures that were eligible for only tiny loans  or none at all.

title: White House Aware of Russian Vaccine Disinformation Efforts
description: The White House press secretary, Jen Psaki, said on Monday that we will fight with every tool to combat Russias efforts to spread disinformation about the Moderna and Pfizer coronavirus vaccines.

title: The Country I Fled Needs Bidens Help Now
description: Myanmars nominal transition to democracy ended abruptly on Feb. 1 when the military arrested the civilian government and seized power. This coup was the most egregious among the three in the countrys modern history. The military claimed it was acting in response to election irregularities, but the charges it later imposed on elected leaders  the countrys civilian leader, Daw Aung San Suu Kyi, was accused of illegally importing walkie-talkies, for example  were preposterous. Of course, the Burmese military leaders actual goal is to nullify the results of the November 2020 democratic elections.

title: 10 Years After Fukushima Disaster, This Nurse May Be the Regions Best Hope
description: Rina Tsugawa recalls a charmed childhood amid rice paddies in northeastern Japan, hopping on bicycles with her sister and roaming the streets of their village, where monkeys sometimes descended from the mountains and neighbors offered the girls sweets as they popped into their homes.

title: The Virus Cost Performers Their Work, Then Their Health Coverage
description: Ellyn Marie Marsh was getting ready to appear in a new off-Broadway musical last year when the pandemic struck, theaters were shut and her work evaporated.

title: Down With the British Monarchy
description: A recent interview you may have heard about revealed that the British monarchy is a toxic den of backbiting and racism. And who would doubt it? There is nothing easier to believe than that an institution created to be the physical embodiment of classism is awash in inhumanity. Where the public response to this humdrum revelation has gone astray is in the widespread conviction that we should make the monarchy better. Not at all. You cannot turn a bottle of poison into a refreshing drink, no matter how much sugar you pour into it.

title: Disneyland will reopen in late April, Disneys chief executive says.
description: Disneyland, which has been closed for a year, will reopen in late April.

title: On-Demand Webinar: Writing for Podcasts
description: Student-produced podcasts are an engaging way to merge project-based learning, storytelling and digital media skills. Podcasts give students a voice  an opportunity to tell their story, teach something new or explore a topic thats important to them. This multimedia form of expression has exploded in popularity over the last several years and further surged during the coronavirus pandemic.

title: A Trauma Expert Puts the Meghan and Harry Interview in Context
description: Oprah Winfreys interview this week with Prince Harry and his wife, Meghan, Duchess of Sussex, revealed simmering divisions within the royal family, and a deep, abiding sense of loss felt by the prince after his mothers death in 1997 that intensified amid the subsequent tabloid coverage. Prince Harry, who has become a prominent advocate for mental health causes, has frequently spoken about this loss and its effect on his mental health.

title: BuzzFeed lays off 47 HuffPost workers weeks after acquisition.
description: When BuzzFeed announced last year that it would buy HuffPost, it was expected that cost-cutting would follow the completion of the deal. On Tuesday, less than a month after the acquisition went through, BuzzFeed laid off 47 workers at HuffPost and closed the publications Canadian edition.

title: Tiny Love Stories: I Had to Take Your Picture
description: A blue dawn as I think about how life will proceed without 80-year-old me. How to make those dim vapors disperse? Eggs, coffee, a thin slice of toast and  dare I open a jar of my homemade marmalade? With the inordinate work to make the jam  slicing countless sour oranges into small pieces  Ive always saved these jars to give to special people. But today, in a wild, life-affirming gesture, I open the preserves for myself. Sticky and runny, the marmalade acts as an elixir, melting away the trailing wisps of blue.  Marilyn Slutzky Zucker

title: Hawaii Governor Declares State of Emergency After Floods
description: Gov. David Ige of Hawaii on Tuesday declared a state of emergency citing extensive damage across the state following torrential rain and flooding that prompted evacuations orders on the islands of Maui and Oahu and damaged at least a half dozen homes.

title: After Meghan and Harrys Interview: Sympathy and Cynicism
description: To the Editor:

title: N.F.L. Asked to Address Race-Based Evaluations in Concussion Settlement
description: The judge overseeing the landmark N.F.L. concussion settlement ordered a mediator to look into concerns about the leagues use of separate scoring curves  one for Black athletes, another for white players  used by doctors to evaluate dementia-related claims that retired players say explicitly and deliberately discriminated against hundreds if not thousands of Black players.

title: Wyoming lawmakers weigh runoff legislation that could hurt Liz Cheney.
description: Wyoming Republicans this week are considering a change to state election law that may make it harder for one of their own  Representative Liz Cheney  to win re-election next year.

title: Artists at Studio in a School Consider Joining a Union
description: Workers and artists at Studio in a School, a nonprofit group founded more than 40 years ago to teach art in public schools, have organized an effort to join a union.

title: A Modern Classic Addresses Elemental Questions About Love and Power
description: Its a fact readily acknowledged that one can encounter some books simply too late in life to appreciate  or, in some cases, even tolerate  them. The famous examples include The Catcher in the Rye, most of the Beats, all of Anas Nin. But Im more curious about the counterpoint: Those books said to require experience, and age, to unlock.

title: Police Responded to a 911 Call and Left. Then a Child Was Killed.
description: The day before a 10-year-old boy named Ayden Wolfe was found beaten to death in his apartment in Harlem, someone called 911.

title: The Red Sox Hope the Ghosts of 2018 Wont Haunt Them
description: The Boston Red Sox picked the right season for their worst winning percentage since 1965. Sure, they lost 36 of their 60 games in 2020, and their 5.58 earned run average was the highest in team history. But there were no witnesses in the Fenway Park stands, and they left the scene in a hurry.

title: New York to Spend $65 Million to Rescue Cab Drivers. Is It Enough?
description: For years, a generation of New York City taxi drivers who wanted to own their own cabs were channeled into exploitative loans that left them deeply in debt, or even bankrupted. The city, which reaped hundreds of millions of dollars from the practice, ignored their plight.

title: Breaking From Trump, Biden Opts Against Branding Stimulus Checks
description: WASHINGTON  The next round of stimulus checks that Congress is expected to approve this week will not include President Bidens name, a White House official said on Tuesday, a decision that breaks with the practice of his predecessor, President Donald J. Trump, who sought to take credit for the payments by personally branding them.

title: Allan McDonald Dies at 83; Tried to Stop the Challenger Launch
description: Allan J. McDonald, an engineer who on a chilly January morning in 1986 tried to stop the launch of the Challenger space shuttle, citing the possible effect of the cold on its booster rockets, and who, after it broke apart on liftoff, blew the whistle when government officials tried to cover up his dissent, died on Saturday in Ogden, Utah. He was 83.

title: Meyers Leonard Will Be Away From Heat Indefinitely After Use of Anti-Semitic Slur
description: Meyers Leonard, a reserve center for the Miami Heat, will be away from the team indefinitely, the team said Tuesday night, following his use of an anti-Semitic slur while he was playing a video game on a public livestream.

title: Portraits of George W. Bush and Bill Clinton are back on prominent display, a White House official said.
description: The White House has restored the official portraits of former Presidents George W. Bush and Bill Clinton to a traditional display spot after they were moved to a less prominent location last year, a Biden administration official said.

title: In New Plan, National Geographic Will Move an Acclaimed Sculpture
description: National Geographic Society has pledged to preserve and relocate a seminal outdoor sculpture that the society argued was blocking its ability to expand and improve its campus in Washington.

title: Kaia, Kendall and EmRata Are Taking a Page From Oprah
description: To hear more audio stories from publishers like The New York Times, download Audm for iPhone or Android.

title: Honduran Leader Vowed to Help Flood U.S. With Cocaine, Prosecutor Says
description: President Juan Orlando Hernndez of Honduras promised to protect drug traffickers using the nations security forces and law enforcement agencies, and to help them flood the United States with cocaine, an American prosecutor said on Tuesday.

title: Roger Mudd, Anchorman Who Stumped a Kennedy, Is Dead at 93
description: Roger Mudd, the anchorman who delivered the news and narrated documentaries with an urbane edge for three decades on CBS, NBC and PBS and conducted a 1979 interview that undermined the presidential hopes of Senator Edward M. Kennedy, died on Tuesday at his home in McLean, Va. He was 93.

title: On-Gaku: Our Sound Review: They Will Rock You
description: Rock n roll is here to stay, and so is On-Gaku: Our Sound, a quirky homage to classic animation and 1960s-70s rock with an idiosyncratic style and the thrumming heart of a musician.

title: In Royal Firm, the Family Business Always Comes First
description: When Prince Harrys wife, Meghan, referred to the British royal family as the Firm in their dramatic interview with Oprah Winfrey on Sunday, she evoked an institution that is as much a business as a fantasy. It is now a business in crisis, after the couple leveled charges of racism and cruelty against members of the family.

title: Womans Search for Her Birth Parents Leads to a Story of Murder
description: In 2017, Kathy Gillcrist, newly retired from her job as a high school teacher, was wondering what she would do next.

title: Cuomo Faces New Accusation of Inappropriate Touching
description: ALBANY, N.Y.  A female aide to Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo has accused the governor of inappropriately touching her late last year at the Executive Mansion in Albany, according to a published report.

title: For Chuck Schumer, a Dream Job Comes With Tall Orders
description: WASHINGTON  The moment Chuck Schumer achieved his longtime dream of becoming Senate majority leader, he was in a secure room hiding from a violent pro-Trump mob that was rampaging through the Capitol.

title: Trump, Hungry for Power, Tries to Wrestle Away G.O.P. Fund-Raising
description: WASHINGTON  It was a familiar play by Donald J. Trump: lashing out at his enemies and trying to raise money from it.

title: Coronavirus Briefing: What Happened Today
description: Months into the vaccine rollout, many Americans with underlying medical conditions are desperate to know: When can I get vaccinated?

title: Vaccines, Stimulus, The Phantom Tollbooth: Your Tuesday Evening Briefing
description: (Want to get this newsletter in your inbox? Heres the sign-up.)

title: Barbara Ess, 76, Dies; Artist Blurred Lines Between Life and Art
description: Barbara Ess, an artist and musician best known for plumbing the limits of perception with a pinhole camera, died on Thursday at her home in Elizaville, N.Y. She was 76.

title: Why Oprahs Meghan and Harry Special Wont Have a Streaming Home
description: Oprah Winfrey pulled off what has become a rare television event: the tell-all interview that turns into a cultural moment. On Sunday, an audience of more than 17 million watched bombshell revelations tumble out of the mouths of Meghan Markle and Prince Harry as they described their lives under the palace gaze in a two-hour CBS special that rivaled any of the royal dramas on the Netflix series The Crown.

title: Californias Ethnic Studies Follies
description: The first time Californias Department of Education published a draft of an ethnic studies model curriculum for high school students, in 2019, it managed the neat trick of omitting anti-Semitism while committing it.

title: The D.C.C.C. Blacklist Is No More
description: When she challenged Representative Joe Crowley in 2018, Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez did it by knocking on over 100,000 doors in her New York City district, calling even more peoples phones, and sending out still more text messages.

title: What happened on the first day of jury selection at the Derek Chauvin trial?
description: The first three jurors were selected on Tuesday for the trial of Derek Chauvin, the former Minneapolis police officer accused of second-degree murder in the death of George Floyd.

title: House Passes Labor Rights Expansion, but Senate Chances Are Slim
description: WASHINGTON  House Democrats on Tuesday approved the most significant expansion of labor rights since the New Deal, advancing legislation that would neutralize right-to-work laws in 27 states and bolster workers ability to organize after years of eroding clout.

title: Heavy Rainfall in Hawaii Forces Evacuations
description: Residents on the island of Maui in Hawaii were forced to evacuate after torrential rainfall caused a dam to overflow, damaging at least half a dozen homes in the area.

title: Why Are We So Obsessed With Royalty?
description: My 4-year-old daughter is into princesses. Really into princesses. I have given the Princess Industrial Complex more money than Id like to admit to keep those episodes of Elena of Avalor coming.

title: Piers Morgan Leaves Good Morning Britain After Attacks on Meghan
description: Piers Morgan, who drew intense scorn in Britain for his upbraiding of Meghan, the Duchess of Sussex, since her bombshell interview with Oprah Winfrey, resigned on Tuesday as an anchor for ITV news after storming off the set of the networks morning show.

title: Biden Nominees Vow to Avoid Politicizing Justice Dept.
description: WASHINGTON  President Bidens nominees to fill out the Justice Departments leadership ranks pledged at their confirmation hearing on Tuesday to tackle domestic extremism, racial inequality and other thorny issues within the bounds of the law, seeking to restore order to a department battered by political attacks during the Trump administration.

title: Recall of Kia Vehicles Comes With a Special Caution: Dont Park in the Garage
description: In the realm of consumer alerts, the advisory Tuesday from the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration about a recall of nearly 380,000 Kia vehicles was the equivalent of a flashing dashboard light.

title: Court Dismisses Trump Campaigns Defamation Suit Against New York Times
description: A New York State court on Tuesday dismissed a defamation lawsuit filed by the re-election campaign of Donald J. Trump against The New York Times Company, ruling that an opinion essay that argued there had been a quid pro quo between the candidate and Russian officials before the 2016 presidential election was protected speech.

title: Like Some Shrimp and Jets
description: WEDNESDAY PUZZLE  What a joy of a puzzle we have today! This is Nancy Stark and Will Nedigers fifth collaboration, and they clearly have a formula that works. There were so many standout clues in this puzzle, but I especially wanted to point out the symmetrical IRISH PUBS and SPORTS BAR at 10-Down and 32-Down, which put a big smile on my face when I filled them both in.

title: Your Wednesday Briefing
description: Since a coup last month, the Tatmadaw, as the military in Myanmar is known, is now fully back in charge, and its brutal practices are being watched with horror by the rest of the world. It recently turned its guns on the masses in response to a nationwide civil disobedience movement.

title: Quotation of the Day: Some of Canadas Elderly Are Vaccinated but Still Confined to Home
description: You always hear people say, Oh they lived a long life. Right now, they arent living. They are existing.

title: Corrections: March 10, 2021
description: A picture caption with an article on Tuesday about victims of violence by Myanmars military misstated the date of a protest at which officers were shown lined up in a security cordon. It took place on Feb. 9, not on Tuesday.

title: A City Ruptured
description: The pandemics toll on New York Citys economy and way of life was laid bare on its streets.

title: Los Angeles Schools and Teachers Union Agree to Reopen Classrooms
description: The Los Angeles Unified School District and its teachers union have reached a tentative agreement to restore in-person instruction, clearing the way for a mid-April reopening of some classrooms in one of the last large school districts to bring students back in substantial numbers.

title: Illinois Prison Guard Pleads Guilty for Role in Beating Inmate to Death
description: A state prison guard in Illinois pleaded guilty on Tuesday to two counts of federal civil rights violations and one count of conspiracy to engage in misleading conduct in the 2018 beating death of an inmate who had been handcuffed, prosecutors said.

title: PGA Tour Is About to Admit Its Largest Crowd of the Year
description: PONTE VEDRA BEACH, Fla.  After eight months of hosting events without fans, the PGA Tour recently began cautiously welcoming back a limited number of spectators to its tournaments. This week, at the celebrated Players Championship in northeast Florida, the tour will take a leap with as many as 10,000 fans on the grounds, the most for any event this year.

title: Word of the Day: unbecoming
Royals Interview Response Rings Hollow to Late-Night Hosts
description: Welcome to Best of Late Night, a rundown of the previous nights highlights that lets you sleep  and lets us get paid to watch comedy. Were all stuck at home at the moment, so here are the 50 best movies on Netflix right now.

title: Sweet Dreams
In Australia, Hollywood Stars Have Found an Escape From the Virus. Whos Jealous?
description: MELBOURNE, Australia  In the photo posted to Instagram, the actors Chris Hemsworth, Idris Elba and Matt Damon, all wearing 1980s-style sweats, embrace. They are maskless. Touching. Happy, even. The caption reads: A little 80s themed party never did any harm!

title: Lesson of the Day: 2 Days, 10 Dogs, 150 Miles in the Wilderness: This Is the Iditarod for Teens
description: Featured Article: 2 Days, 10 Dogs, 150 Miles in the Wilderness: This Is the Iditarod for Teens by Marlena Sloss

title: Furor in Japanese Town Casts Light on Fukushimas Legacy
description: SUTTSU, Japan  It seemed like an easy payday. The Japanese government was conducting a study of potential locations for storing spent nuclear fuel  a review of old geological maps and research papers about local plate tectonics. It put out a call for localities to volunteer. Participating would commit them to nothing.

title: Covid-19 Devastated Many Communities. But Not Cherokee Nation.
description: It all starts with universal health care and a history of self-reliance.

title: 19 Songs That Matter Right Now
description: These are the artists who got us through a pandemic year. Listen for yourself.

title: Whos Next in Your States Vaccine Line?
description: Enter your state and well tell you.

title: Covid-19 Devastated Many Communities. But Not Cherokee Nation.
description: The Cherokee Nation of Oklahoma has kept its Covid death rate lower than most American communities  even though Native Americans are almost twice as likely to die from Covid-19 as white people are. In this video, we uncover the secret to the Cherokees success. But its not exactly rocket science. Its really just a smart, slow but steady commitment to universal health care. Oh, and a long history of having to be self-reliant when the U.S. government fails to step up and provide support.

title: Should the Government Provide a Guaranteed Income for Families With Children?
description: According to the government definition of poverty, about 10 million children in the United States fall under this category. Does that surprise you? How does knowing this make you feel?

title: How Biden Funds His Next Bill: Shrink the $7.5 Trillion Tax Gap
description: With the passage of a deficit-financed $1.9 trillion relief bill just hours away, Democrats in Congress may soon pivot to new agenda items, including President Bidens Build Back Better plan for infrastructure and other critical investments. And those lawmakers will inevitably face intense pressure from fiscal moderates to include tax pay fors in spending legislation. One of the best ways to raise plenty of revenue  and help honest taxpayers  is to effectively battle tax cheats. To do that, though, Mr. Biden and Congress must seize the chance to revamp and restore the federal governments own infrastructure: the Internal Revenue Service.

title: Cancel Americas Student Loan Debt! But How?
description: The problem of student loan debt has reached crisis proportions. As a college degree has grown increasingly necessary for economic mobility, so has the $1.7 trillion in student loan debt that Americans have taken on to access that opportunity. President Biden has put some debt cancellation on the table, but progressive Democrats are pushing him for more. So what is the fairest way to correct course?

title: Getting to the Bottom of the Runners High
description: We can stop crediting endorphins, the natural opioid painkillers produced by our bodies, for the floaty euphoria we often feel during aerobic exercise, according to a nifty new study of men, women and treadmills. In the study, runners developed a gentle intoxication, known as a runners high, even if researchers had blocked their bodies ability to respond to endorphins, suggesting that those substances could not be behind the buzz. Instead, the study suggests, a different set of biochemicals resembling internally homegrown versions of cannabis, better known as marijuana, are likely to be responsible.

title: Do You Really Need to Fly?
description: I once flew round-trip from San Francisco to London to participate in an hourlong discussion about a book. Another time it was San Francisco-Hong Kong, Hong Kong-Singapore and back again for two lunch meetings, each more lunch than meeting. I went to Atlanta once to interview an official who flaked out at the last minute. And there was that time in Miami: three days, 5,000 miles, hotel, rental car  and on the way back a sinking realization that the person Id gone to profile was too dull for a profile.

title: A Former Culinary Couple Now Thrives as a Blended Family
description: In Unhitched, couples tell the stories of their relationships, from romance to vows to divorce to life afterward.

title: Ballet Is Hard Enough. What Happens When You Lose a Year?
description: In ballet when you lose a year, you lose a lot. It takes years of sacrifice and training to become a professional, and the performing life of a dancer is short.

title: Biden Got the Vaccine Rollout Humming, With Trumps Help
description: WASHINGTON  When President Biden pledged last week to amass enough vaccine by late May to inoculate every adult in the United States, the pronouncement was greeted as a triumphant acceleration of a vaccination campaign that seemed to be faltering only weeks earlier.

title: A City Strapped: Photographing a New York in Need
description: Times Insider explains who we are and what we do, and delivers behind-the-scenes insights into how our journalism comes together.

title: What Happens to Your Mental Health When You Cant Pay Your Rent?
description: Nearly every week for the past two years, I have gotten on the phone with a director of suicide prevention at a very large mental health system in the United States, and we review cases of suicides. For the dead, we go over their demographics, psychiatric diagnoses, how they died by suicide and all of their interactions with the mental health system, from clinic intakes to the last notes from their final therapy sessions.

title: Closing of Beloved Dim Sum Hall Leaves a Crater in Reeling Chinatown
description: Jing Fong was everyones place.

title: Tasmanian Tigers Are Extinct. Why Do People Keep Seeing Them?
description: The Tasmanian tiger is still extinct. Reports of its enduring survival are greatly exaggerated.

title: Living In ... Maywood, N.J.
description: With its walkable streets and proximity to Manhattan, the Bergen County borough is an appealing place to live. But this spring, inventory is scarce.

title: Xis Gambit: China Plans for a World Without American Technology
description: China is freeing up tens of billions of dollars for its tech industry to borrow. It is cataloging the sectors where the United States or others could cut off access to crucial technologies. And when its leaders released their most important economic plans last week, they laid out their ambitions to become an innovation superpower beholden to none.

title: Democrats Are Anxious About 2022  and 2024
description: In the wake of the 2020 election, Democratic strategists are worried  very worried  about the future of the Hispanic vote. One in 10 Latinos who supported Hillary Clinton in 2016 switched to Donald Trump in 2020.

title: Harlan Coben, Suburban Dad With 75 Million Books in Print
description: RIDGEWOOD, N.J.  The thriller writer Harlan Coben has some free advice for anyone who cares to ask: If it produces pages: good. If it doesnt produce pages: bad.

title: Maywood, N.J.: A Close-Knit Community With a Quaint Downtown
description: Beata Piszczek has had some lucky breaks, starting in 1994 when she won Polands green card lottery, providing the ticket for her family to come to the United States, and again last year, when she landed her dream house in Maywood, N.J., just a block from the boroughs downtown.

title: 13 Spring Recipes to Add to Your Cooking List
description: The arrival of spring is always a most-welcome event, but, this year, its approach feels even more deserving of celebration. In honor of the warmer weather, bright blooms and vibrant farmers markets on the horizon, you can and should make these ultimate spring dishes from NYT Cooking, which make the most of the seasons verdant produce  and scream Spring is here!

title: A $22,368 Bill That Dodged and Weaved to Find a Gap in Americas Health System
description: John Druschitz spent five days in a Texas hospital last April with fever and shortness of breath. It was still the early days of the pandemic, and doctors puzzled over a diagnosis.

title: Anguish, Determination, Hope: Travel Workers Despair a Lost Year
description: In 2020, governments across the world closed borders, airlines grounded flights, hotels shuttered and cruises were canceled or postponed.

title: Black and Hispanic Communities Grapple With Vaccine Misinformation
description: SAN JOSE, Calif.  On an unseasonably warm day in February, two men working with a local community group went door to door in an ethnically diverse neighborhood to persuade people to sign up for Covid-19 vaccinations.

title: Why Is Space Command Moving Into Mo Brookss Backyard?
description: As uncommon as it is for the White House to worry about where the Pentagon puts its people and hardware, President Biden may need to follow the example of his predecessor and take a hard look at the site selection for U.S. Space Command. It tells a tale of two cities, Colorado Springs and Huntsville, Ala., and reveals a lot about our modern-day season of stunt guillotines and Trumpist revolutionaries.

title: Police Unions Won Power Using His Playbook. Now Hes Negotiating the Backlash.
description: Ron DeLord, a fiery former Texas cop turned labor organizer, has long taught union leaders how to gain power and not let go. He has likened a police union going after an elected official to a cheetah devouring a wildebeest, and suggested that taking down just one would make others fall in line.

title: Theres No Town Left: Fukushimas Eerie Landscapes
description: FUKUSHIMA, Japan  After an earthquake and tsunami pummeled a nuclear plant about 12 miles from their home, Tomoko Kobayashi and her husband joined the evacuation and left their Dalmatian behind, expecting they would return home in a few days.

title: Where Is Hollywood When Broadway Needs It?
description: Dear Extremely Famous Friend of the American Theater,

title: Bill Frisell Is Still Playing We Shall Overcome
description: He has spent half a century with a guitar, and with this song.

title: Who Are These Kids, and What Are They Doing to Jazz?
description: J.D. Beck and DOMi are so young and virtuosic that it feels as if they must be kidding you.

title: Taylor Swifts Indie Act
description: Long, long ago, this might have felt strange.

title: Sophies Pleasure-Seeking Sonic Deluge
description: After she died, fans mourned the loss of an artist who seemed to be addressing them from a better, freer future.

title: Dua Lipas Master Class in Pop Ubiquity
description: Her music was everywhere, even in a year when we went nowhere.

title: A Celebration of Sex in a Year of Deprivation
description: Cardi B and Megan Thee Stallions WAP served up the audio equivalent of a sundae.

title: La Doa Was Ready to Be a Pop Star
description: But her EP dropped just as the country was shutting down.

title: Jyotis Music to Mourn By
description: The singer and producer Georgia Anne Muldrow captures the magnitude of this years grief.

title: The key to President Bidens successful vaccination campaign? Underpromise and overdeliver.
description: When President Biden pledged last week to amass enough shots by late May to inoculate every American adult, the pronouncement was greeted as a triumphant acceleration of a vaccination campaign that seemed only weeks earlier to be faltering.

title: Jazmine Sullivans Characters Are Looking in the Mirror
description: With intimacy out of reach, her songs are good for self-examination.

title: You Might Never Guess That Jacob Collier Was a Genius
description: He's a staggering musical prodigy  with strangely mundane songs.

title: How Moses Sumney Found Himself in Maximalism
description: After years of uncertainty over what he was meant to be, the singer realized he could be everything at once.

title: Sam Hunts Pop-Country Brilliance
description: Beer, trucks, heterosexual love ... he knows how to play a country music clich to his advantage.

title: SAULTs Hymn for Black Liberation
description: Hard Life acknowledges the pain of a centuries-long struggle  and promises deliverance.

title: Freddie Gibbs Was Always Weirder Than We Thought
description: A gangster rapper with art-house leanings reinvents himself again.

title: Phoebe Bridgers Is Alive With Melancholy
description: Theres this stamp that I can put on bad things. Got a song out of it. Its weird, but, wow, thats my job.

title: Do Drakes Melodramas Still Matter?
description: Its hard to pinpoint exactly when he stopped feeling vital, but Toosie Slide crystallized it.

title: Koffees Escape From Quarantine
description: The Jamaican roots-reggae star made her name on wholesome pleasures. But her single Lockdown is more than it seems.

title: Beverly Glenn-Copelands New Age Revival
description: The 77-year-olds music offers escape; his life, resilience.

title: Everything Emma Ruth Rundle Sings Sounds Like a Warning
description: Her songs offer a glimpse of the setting sun before the horrors of night descend.

title: The Dangerous Job of Making Deliveries in N.Y.C.
description: [Want to get New York Today by email? Heres the sign-up.]

title: Russia Says It Is Slowing Access to Twitter
description: MOSCOW  The Russian government said on Wednesday that it was slowing access to Twitter, accusing the social network of failing to remove illegal content and signaling that the Kremlin is escalating its offensive against American internet companies that have long provided a haven for freedom of expression.

title: Your Loved Ones, and Eerie Tom Cruise Videos, Reanimate Unease With Deepfakes
description: To those fearful of a future in which videos of real people are indistinguishable from computer-generated forgeries, two recent developments that attracted an audience of millions might have seemed alarming.

title: Who Made My Crossword?
description: Editors note: Ms. Saint-Cyr, who made her New York Times Crossword debut on Feb. 1 at age 17, is the youngest woman to have a puzzle published in The New York Times.

title: I Thought I Was Going to Die: A Capitol Police Officer Recounts Jan. 6
description: When Officer Harry Dunn reported for work at the Capitol on the morning of Jan. 6, he expected a day of relatively normal protests.

title: Biden announces his intention to secure another 100 million doses of Johnson & Johnsons vaccine.
description: President Biden said on Wednesday that he was directing the federal government to secure an additional 100 million doses of Johnson & Johnsons Covid-19 single-shot vaccine, a move the White House said could help the country vaccinate children and, if necessary, administer booster doses or reformulate the vaccine to combat emerging variants of the virus.

title: The New Hong Kong
description: Chinas crackdown on Hong Kong has happened swiftly: A rising power has asserted its authority over a global financial capital, through a harsh national security law enacted last summer.

title: How to Apologize to Your Kids
description: A year into working from my bedroom, I thought I had reached an emotional equilibrium where I could tolerate the multiple kid interruptions throughout my day. But last week, my older daughter was assigned a scavenger hunt in remote school. She barged through my door  which I am sorry to report has no lock  four times in one hour, looking for slippers, something red (twice) and a hairbrush. On the fourth interruption, I snapped. Youve got to get out of here, I said, in a voice much harsher than I like to use with my children.

title: The Conspiracy Talk Threatening a $360 Million TV Deal
description: The offending chant had been broadcast during Turkish league matches for months before anyone noticed it. The refrain, a variation of which is often heard in stadiums around Turkey, ends with a profanity directed at Fenerbahce, one of the countrys biggest and richest clubs.

title: E.U. Exports Millions of Covid Vaccine Doses Despite Supply Crunch at Home
description: BRUSSELS  The European Union exported 34 million doses of coronavirus vaccines in recent weeks to dozens of countries, even as it faced shortages at home that contributed to its vaccine rollout trailing far behind drives in the United States, Britain and Israel.

title: He Quit the Internet 2 Months Before the Pandemic
description: Aron Rosenberg was on a road trip last summer when he realized his mind wasnt working the way it used to.

title: After testing negative for the coronavirus, an uninsured man wasnt eligible for help with his $22,368 hospital bill.
description: John Druschitz spent five days in a Texas hospital last April with fever and shortness of breath as doctors puzzled over a diagnosis.

title: Is a Long-Dismissed Forgery Actually the Oldest Known Biblical Manuscript?
description: In 1883, a Jerusalem antiquities dealer named Moses Wilhelm Shapira announced the discovery of a remarkable artifact: 15 manuscript fragments, supposedly discovered in a cave near the Dead Sea. Blackened with a pitchlike substance, their paleo-Hebrew script nearly illegible, they contained what Shapira claimed was the original Book of Deuteronomy, perhaps even Moses own copy.

title: With House passage, Congress clears the nearly $1.9 trillion stimulus plan for President Bidens signature.
description: Congress gave final approval on Wednesday to President Bidens sweeping, nearly $1.9 trillion stimulus package, as Democrats acted over unified Republican opposition to push through an emergency pandemic aid plan that carries out a vast expansion of the countrys social safety net.

title: The Rise of an Antitrust Pioneer
description: Word that the White House plans to pick Lina Khan, a Columbia Law professor whose research has spurred a rethinking of competition law, for a seat on the Federal Trade Commission has Washington and business types speculating that the Biden administration is preparing to get tough on antitrust. (She would need to be confirmed by the Senate.)

title: China and Russia Agree to Explore the Moon Together
description: China and Russia have agreed to jointly build a research station on or around the moon, setting the stage for a new space race.

title: What to Know About Newsoms State of the State
description: (This article is part of the California Today newsletter. Sign up to get it delivered to your inbox.)

title: Inflation Fear Lurks, Even as Officials Say Not to Worry
description: While the Biden administrations ambitious effort to salve the pandemics deep economic wounds made its way through Congress, proponents insisted that funneling $1.9 trillion to American households and businesses wouldnt unshackle a long-vanquished monster: inflation.

title: On the Road Again at All-Star Weekend
description: Sundays 70th N.B.A. All-Star Game was repeatedly described as one almost all of us could have done without.

title: How to Decorate Your New Home Before You Move
description: Moving in a pandemic has special challenges  especially if your new place is across the country and you cant make repeated visits to gradually set things up. And shopping for furniture in crowded stores may make some people uneasy while the Covid-19 vaccines are still being distributed.

title: What You Get for $1.1 Million
description: A two-bedroom condo in a Gilded Age mansion in Newport, a modernized 1945 house in Charlottesville and a Victorian in Crown Point.

title: How Beautiful We Were, by Imbolo Mbue: An Excerpt
description: We should have known the end was near. How could we not have known? When the sky began to pour acid and rivers began to turn green, we should have known our land would soon be dead. Then again, how could we have known when they didnt want us to know? When we began to wobble and stagger, tumbling and snapping like feeble little branches, they told us it would soon be over, that we would all be well in no time. They asked us to come to village meetings, to talk about it. They told us we had to trust them.

title: The Yankees Will Have to Get Creative in Zack Brittons Absence
description: The Yankees acquired Zack Britton in a trade with the Baltimore Orioles on July 24, 2018. Two days later, he made his first appearance in pinstripes, and soon became a mainstay in the bullpen and a leading voice in the clubhouse.

title: For Creators, Everything Is for Sale
description: A rash of new start-ups are making it easier for digital creators to monetize every aspect of their life  down to what they eat, who they hang out with and who they respond to on TikTok.

title: New Zealand and Luna Rossa Each Score a Win on First Day of Americas Cup
description: After a series of preliminary races dominated by Italy, the Americas Cup began in earnest off Auckland, New Zealand, with much more competitive racing on Wednesday. After the first two legs, the challenger, Italy, and the Cup holder, New Zealand, were tied at one race each.

title: A Former Courthouse (and Current Hotel) in La Paz
description: This registered historic building in La Paz, Mexico, with a 10-bedroom home set around a central courtyard, is on the market for $1.25 million.

title: House Hunting in Mexico: A 19th-Century Courthouse Turned Hacienda
description: Since 1880, this squat white building on a bustling corner in La Paz, Mexico, has served many people in many roles. It has been a Chinese imports retail shop, a courthouse, an art gallery and, for several decades after the court moved to a modern government building, a forgotten relic. The current owner bought it in 1996 and transformed it into a boutique hotel called El Angel Azul.

title: Police Officer Is Arrested Over London Womans Disappearance
description: LONDON  A police officer is being held on suspicion of murder in connection with the disappearance of a woman who went missing last week as she was on her way home in South London, the police said on Wednesday.

title: Bidens nominees for top posts at the Justice Dept. vow to restore order there.
description: President Bidens nominees to fill out the Justice Departments leadership ranks pledged at their confirmation hearing on Tuesday to tackle domestic extremism, racial inequality and other thorny issues within the bounds of the law, seeking to restore order to a department battered by political attacks during the Trump administration.

title: $1.1 Million Homes in Rhode Island, Virginia and Indiana
description: Designed by Dudley Newton, a prolific architect in Newport, this Dutch Renaissance-style house was constructed with locally quarried granite. It dates from 1884, when it was built for the Weld family, a pedigreed clan of merchants, doctors and lawyers, many named William. (The former Massachusetts governor William F. Weld is a descendant.) From 1925 to 1972, the house was a Catholic boys school. Then it was converted into multifamily residences, part of a development called the De La Salle Condominiums, with eight buildings and a total of 38 units, four of which are in this structure.

title: 3 Art Gallery Shows to See Right Now
description: Its hard to choose the right word to describe Shinichi Sawadas spiky, totemic sculptures. His earth-toned ceramics  which often have horns and claws, as well as multiple faces stacked atop one another or ringing the sides  could be beasts, except theyre not very menacing. Id say monsters, but neither do they inspire fear. Theyre not quite animals or spirits. Creatures may be the most apt  it speaks to the interplay between natural elements and feats of imagination.

title: What to Cook Right Now
description: Good morning. Ive been talking a lot about no-recipe recipes recently, in advance of the publication of New York Times Cooking: No-Recipe Recipes next week, and my colleague Tina Jordan reached out to me the other day with a stellar one. Its for a fiery weeknight pasta dish with brussels sprouts and diced bacon.

title: N.F.L. Salary Cap Drops to $182.5 Million for 2021
description: The N.F.L. has determined the salary cap for the 2021 season, saying each team will have $182.5 million to spend on player payroll, nearly 8 percent less than in 2020, when revenues were cleaved by the coronavirus pandemic. In 2020, the salary cap was $198.2 million, a league record.

title: A Ticking Time Bomb: City Jails Are Crowded Again, Stoking Covid Fears
description: New York Citys jails were under such threat from the coronavirus last spring that city officials moved swiftly to let hundreds of people out of the crowded, airless old buildings. The effort shrank the jail population to its lowest point in more than half a century.

title: U.K. Politicians Tread Carefully in Minefield Left by Harry and Meghans Interview
description: More than 11 million people in Britain tuned into Oprah Winfreys interview with Prince Harry and his wife, Meghan. Fallout from the interview has reverberated globally, raising sensitive issues of race, rocking the royal family, upsetting the Commonwealth and exposing a sharp generational divide over the future of the British monarchy.

title: On the Scene as a Much Anticipated Trial Begins
description: The first jurors were seated in the closely watched trial over the death of George Floyd.

title: Reluctantly, a Coal State Pivots to Wind
description: Generations of Wyoming residents found a steady paycheck in coal mines and took pride in powering the nation. But now, its energy from the regions other abundant energy resource, wind, thats creating jobs and much-needed tax revenues in one county.

title: South Korea Will Pay More for U.S. Troop Presence
description: SEOUL, South Korea  South Korea said on Wednesday that it had agreed to increase its share in covering the cost of the American military presence by 13.9 percent this year, removing a prolonged dispute in the alliance ahead of a joint visit by Secretary of State Antony J. Blinken and Secretary of Defense Lloyd J. Austin III.

title: Two Trump stalwarts find a new cause: #FreeBritney.
description: Two Republicans who rose to prominence by defending President Trump have seized on a new issue  the battle over the legal guardianship of Britney Spears, the former teen pop star who has suffered a succession of personal, professional and financial crises.

title: He Owns World Famous Stamps and a Prized Coin. Now Hes Selling.
description: On the day in 1918 when the Postal Service began selling stamps with an image of a newfangled airplane, a 29-year-old stockbrokers clerk and stamp collector went out on his lunch hour to buy some. He emerged from the nearest post office with a single sheet of 100.

title: There Will Be Marathons This Fall. But What Will They Look Like?
description: It is a tradition as much a part of the New York City Marathon as the 26.2-mile distance. The singular boom of a cannon  and the start of Frank Sinatras Theme From New York, New York  sending thousands of runners across the start line and over the Verrazzano-Narrows Bridge.

title: Slowly, More Students Return to Classrooms
description: School reopening inched forward across the country this week, as middle school students went back to class in Chicago, and New York City announced that it would welcome tens of thousands of high school students back on March 22.

title: How to Reach the Unvaccinated
description: This article is part of the On Tech newsletter. You can sign up here to receive it weekdays.

title: Beth Moore, a Prominent Evangelical, Splits With Southern Baptists
description: From the outside, the marriage of convenience between white conservative Christians and Donald J. Trump looked like a devoted one: White evangelicals voted for Mr. Trump overwhelmingly in 2016 and stuck with him in 2020, brushing aside perpetual lies and sexual impropriety to support a man they saw as their protector.

title: Review: Royalty as Horror Show in Duchess! Duchess! Duchess!
description: Were you silent, Oprah Winfrey asked Meghan Markle, or were you silenced?

title: What to Expect From the 2021 Oscar Nominations
description: In a normal year, we would have had the Oscars by now. Instead, were just getting started.

title: Its Fraudulent Seduction, but Is It Rape?
description: To the Editor:

title: Charles Hill, Detective Who Found The Scream, Dies at 73
description: Charles Hill, a Scotland Yard detective, stood inside a house in Norway and beheld the artistic treasure he had been searching for: The Scream, Edvard Munchs 1893 masterpiece.

title: How One Church is Vaccinating the Neighborhood
description: In a part of Harlem with low vaccination rates, the Abyssinian Baptist Church is combating an unequal rollout and vaccine wariness through example.

title: Roblox Tops $45 Billion on First Day of Trading as Gaming Booms
description: When the pandemic forced people indoors a year ago, many passed the time by playing games on their iPhones, building gaming computers and exploring the latest blockbuster titles on their Xbox and PlayStation consoles.

title: Colombian Official Refuses to Say if Children Were Killed in Attack on Rebels
description: BOGOT, Colombia  Colombias defense minister said Wednesday that several young people were at a rebel camp recently attacked by the military, but would not confirm reports that children were among those killed, an allegation that fueled deep outrage in a nation reeling from decades of war.

title: A New Aida Lands in the Middle of Frances Culture Wars
description: When Lotte de Beers new production of Verdis Aida recently premiered at the Paris Opera  not to a full house, but to an audience online  she was just relieved it was happening.

title: How Sir Francis Drake and Queen Elizabeth I Made England a Global Power
description: IN SEARCH OF A KINGDOMFrancis Drake, Elizabeth I, and the Perilous Birth of the British EmpireBy Laurence Bergreen

title: In Fulfillment, One-Click Shopping Is Cheap, Easy and Economically Unsustainable
description: To hear him tell it, Jeff Bezos loves stories.

title: Louis Valray Made Only 2 Movies. But Both Are Incredible.
description: Something old is sometimes new as with the rediscovery of French director Louis Valray (1896-1972), whose hitherto unknown films enrich the era of Jean Vigo, Jean Renoir, Sacha Guitry and Marcel Carn.

title: Your Thursday Briefing
description: The $1.9 trillion stimulus package, President Joe Bidens first major legislative undertaking, won final approval in the House of Representatives on Wednesday. Mr. Biden is expected to sign the bill on Friday.

title: Indoor dining in N.Y.C. and New Jersey can go to 50 percent on March 19, the governors say.
description: Restaurants in New York City and New Jersey will be able to increase indoor dining to 50 percent of capacity starting March 19, the governors of New York and New Jersey said on Wednesday.

title: Iowa Journalist Who Was Arrested at Protest Is Found Not Guilty
description: An Iowa jury acquitted a journalist on Wednesday in a highly unusual trial of a reporter who was arrested last spring as she covered a protest against racism and police violence.

title: N.Y.C. public schools saw very low virus transmission as cases in the city spiked, a study says.
description: New York Citys public schools have seen remarkably low virus transmission compared with the citywide rate of positive test results in the months since the nations largest school system reopened for thousands of students, according to a major new peer-reviewed study in the medical journal Pediatrics.

title: Merrick Garland Is Confirmed as Attorney General
description: WASHINGTON  The Senate voted to confirm Merrick B. Garland on Wednesday to serve as attorney general, giving the former prosecutor and widely respected federal judge the task of leading the Justice Department at a time when the nation faces domestic extremist threats and a reckoning over civil rights.

title: Im So Sorry! Romance Novels, Bad Behavior and Forgiveness
description: A romances happy ending requires that neither of the lead characters do anything unforgivable. But everyones definition of unforgivable is different  so if a character does something a reader considers wildly out of bounds, or if a characters remorse is not finely calibrated enough for the readers taste, it can call the authors whole definition of happiness into question.

title: One Year Later, Rudy Gobert Is at Peace. And Thriving.
description: It was not a time in his life, understandably, that Rudy Gobert is eager to revisit. No one wants to be connected so closely to the day that the N.B.A., suddenly infiltrated by the coronavirus, suspended its season.

title: S-Town: Chapter 1
description: If you keep your mouth shut, youll be surprised what you can learn.

title: S-Town: Chapter 2
description: Has anybody called you?

title: S-Town: Chapter 3
description: Tedious and brief.

title: S-Town: Chapter 4
description: If anybody could find it, it would be me.

title: S-Town: Chapter 5
description: Nobodyll ever change my mind about it.

title: Leaving Afghanistan Now Would Be a Mistake
description: To the Editor:

title: S-Town: Chapter 6
description: Since everyone around here thinks Im a queer anyway.

title: S-Town: Chapter 7
description: Youre beginning to figure it out now, arent you?

title: New Jersey Increases Indoor Capacity Limits to 50 Percent
description: On Wednesday, Gov. Philip D. Murphy of New Jersey announced that indoor dining, casinos, salons and gyms could open at half capacity starting March 19.

title: Season Two, Episode 1: Dustwun
description: In the middle of the night, Pfc. Bowe Bergdahl grabs a notebook, snacks, water, some cash. Then he quietly slips off a remote U.S. Army outpost in eastern Afghanistan and into the dark, open desert. About 20 minutes later, it occurs to him: hes in over his head.

title: What Can Bidens Plan Do for Poverty? Look to Bangladesh.
description: One of the great moral stains on the United States is that the richest and most powerful country in history has accepted staggering levels of child poverty. With final legislative approval of President Bidens $1.9 trillion American Rescue Plan on Wednesday, the United States has decided to scrub at that stain.

title: Sickle Cell Treatment Not Linked to Cancer, Researchers Say
description: Just a few weeks after a promising gene therapy for sickle cell disease seemed to have hit a roadblock, prospects for the treatment now look better. Preliminary data suggesting that it might cause cancer have not held up.

title: Season Two, Episode 2: The Golden Chicken
description: On the move with Bergdahl, the Taliban slip past the U.S. Armys massive effort to find him. During those days and weeks, each side is asking, what is Bergdahl worth to us?

title: Obamacares About to Get a Lot More Affordable. These Maps Show How.
description: Under the stimulus bill passed by Congress this week and set to be signed by President Biden on Friday, nearly all those who buy their own insurance are eligible for a discount.

title: Season Two, Episode 3: Escaping
description: Bergdahls first year in captivity starts with an escape and ends with an escape. In between, he learns necessary, twisted lessons of survival.

title: Two variants may account for half of New York Citys virus cases, analysis finds.
description: Genetic analysis suggests that roughly half of coronavirus cases in New York City now are caused by two new forms of the pathogen, city officials reported on Wednesday.

title: Season Two, Episode 4: The Captors
description: What's happening on the other side of the door?

title: Nostalgia, One Year In
description: Want to get the At Home newsletter in your inbox? Sign up here.

title: Under Fire Over Race, British Media Admit There Might be a Problem
description: LONDON  In the wake of Harry and Meghans explosive interview, an influential professional society speaking for the British news media issued a defiant response, rejecting the idea of racism and intolerance in British coverage of the couple.

title: Season Two, Episode 5: Meanwhile, in Tampa
description: C.I.A., F.B.I., YouTube, the Portland Police Department? There was no handbook for getting Bergdahl back.
