title: A Boat Snarled Traffic. No, Not That Boat.
description: A considerably large boat blocked traffic on a Florida highway for several hours after it fell on the roadway on Thursday night, the authorities said.

title: Our Town: Part One
description: This American Life spent eight months and conducted over one hundred interviews to get to the bottom of what really happened when undocumented workers showed up in one Alabama town.

title: An Ode to Not Meditating
description: Uncross those aching legs, solemn sitter.

title: 9-Year-Old Migrant Girl Dies Trying to Cross Rio Grande Into U.S.
description: A 9-year-old migrant girl drowned while trying to cross the Rio Grande into Texas with her family, according to federal authorities, the first reported death of a child in a new surge of migration along the southwestern border.

title: Supporters of Gun Control Assail Biden Over Delay on Action
description: WASHINGTON  Supporters of gun control lashed out at President Biden on Friday for suggesting a day earlier that gun legislation would not be his next priority even after two mass shootings in a week.

title: Leon Black to Step Down as MoMA Chairman
description: In the face of mounting pressure from prominent artists and activists about his financial ties to the convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein, the investor Leon Black told colleagues Friday that he would not stand for re-election as the chairman of the Museum of Modern Art, according to two people with knowledge of his decision.

title: How Do I Dress for My Pandemic Belly?
description: A lot of us changed shape over the last year as we were shut indoors and the sensory joys of life were pretty much reduced to what might come out of a kitchen, a walk around the block and how much you could hug the person in your household.

title: D.C. Statehood Backers Want to Be Part of Broad Voting Rights Measure in the Senate
description: WASHINGTON  Hoping to capitalize on a Democratic push on voting rights, activists who support making the District of Columbia a state now say they want a stand-alone statehood measure added to a sweeping national election overhaul the Senate is beginning to consider.

title: What You Get for $1.1 Million in California
description: A Tudor Revival bungalow in Los Angeles, a Craftsman house in Oakland and a cottage in Santa Clara.

title: $1.1 Million Homes in California
description: Tucked into a cul-de-sac in the lower Hollywood Hills, this property is within walking distance of the Hollywood Bowl, an amenity the sellers often took advantage of. It is also just off North Highland Avenue, a major artery that takes commuters south to West Hollywood and north to Studio City. Also within walking distance (or a five-minute drive) is the Hollywood and Highland complex, which includes a Metro stop on the downtown-bound Red Line.

title: The Forgotten Sense
description: Hi everyone, phew, we made it to Friday. There was some heaviness in our coverage this week  including some of the neurological symptoms of long-Covid and the King Soopers shooting in Colorado. In between, we tried to splice in some brightness: the prospect of widespread vaccination and a nursing homes first day out of lockdown. To keep the optimism going, wed love to hear what youre most looking forward to in a post-vaccination future. Shoot us an email and we might share your update in a future newsletter. (And if youre still questioning whether a vaccine is for you, take a look at this guide answering your questions about vaccine safety and access.)

title: The C.D.C.s ex-director offers no evidence in favoring speculation that the coronavirus originated in a lab.
description: The former director of the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention said in a CNN clip on Friday that he favored a theory, decried by many scientists and rejected as extremely unlikely by at least one World Health Organization international expert, that the coronavirus escaped from a lab in Wuhan. The former official, Dr. Robert Redfield, offered no evidence and emphasized that it was his opinion.

title: Overlooked No More: Kitty Cone, Trailblazer of the Disability Rights Movement
description: This article is part of Overlooked, a series of obituaries about remarkable people whose deaths, beginning in 1851, went unreported in The Times.

title: Beverly Cleary, Beloved Childrens Book Author, Dies at 104
description: Beverly Cleary, who enthralled tens of millions of young readers with the adventures and mishaps of Henry Huggins and his dog Ribsy, the bratty Ramona Quimby and her older sister Beezus, and other residents of Klickitat Street, died on Thursday in Carmel, Calif. She was 104.

title: ViacomCBS stock tanks, losing more than half its value in less than a week.
description: Shares of ViacomCBS, the media goliath led by Shari Redstone, took a nosedive this week, with the company losing more than half of its market value in just four days.

title: Vaccines, Georgia, Beverly Cleary: Your Friday Evening Briefing
description: (Want to get this newsletter in your inbox? Heres the sign-up.)

title: Beverly Cleary Wrote About Real Life, and Her Readers Loved Her for It
description: Today the letters that fill an authors mailbox often begin, Our class is studying live authors, wrote Beverly Cleary in Why Are Children Writing to Me Instead of Reading?, an essay published in The New York Times Book Review in 1985. Why only living authors, I wondered. Then I caught on that the answer was the expectation of a reply or what children refer to as free stuff.

title: Coronavirus Briefing: What Happened Today
description: By the end of July, the U.S. government will have had enough doses to vaccinate the countrys entire population, with 70 million doses to spare. Tens of millions more doses are promised to the U.S. in the months that follow.

title: France Has Overwhelming Responsibility for Rwanda Genocide, Report Says
description: PARIS  Blinded by its fears of losing influence in Africa and by a colonial view of the continents people, France remained close to the racist, corrupt and violent regime responsible for the 1994 genocide in Rwanda, and bears serious and overwhelming responsibilities, according to a report released Friday.

title: Morris Dickstein, Critic and Cultural Historian, Dies at 81
description: Morris Dickstein, a literary critic, cultural historian and City University of New York professor who was among the last of the first generation of Jewish public intellectuals reared on the Lower East Side, died on Tuesday at his home in Manhattan. He was 81.

title: Michigan G.O.P. Chair Is Criticized After Calling States Top Democrats Witches
description: Ron Weiser, the chair of Michigans Republican Party, drew swift criticism on Friday after a video surfaced that showed him calling top Democratic officials in his state witches and referred to assassination while discussing two Republican congressmen who had voted to impeach former President Donald J. Trump.

title: Why Testing Still Matters
description: Last May, the city of Los Angeles turned a fabled baseball park into a mass testing site for the coronavirus. At its peak, Dodger Stadium was testing 16,000 people a day for the virus, making it the biggest testing site in the world, said Dr. Clemens Hong, who oversees coronavirus testing in Los Angeles County.

title: Who Are Gavin Newsoms Enemies?
description: For Democratic officials aiming at higher office, Californias top political jobs have appeared to be the perfect launchpad.

title: Michael Bennett, Small-Town Doctor Who Pushed for Masks, Dies at 52
description: This obituary is part of a series about people who have died in the coronavirus pandemic. Read about others here.

title: Biden Defines His Underlying Challenge With China: Prove Democracy Works
description: WASHINGTON  At the end of a winding answer on Thursday about competing with China and about his relationship with Xi Jinping, a man he said does not have a democratic bone in his body, President Biden offered up a revealing assessment of one of Americas most pressing challenges.

title: Winnipegs New Showcase and Meeting Place for Inuit Art and Artists
description: Winnipeg sits far from the territory of the Inuit. But the Winnipeg Art Gallery has long been the leading collector of their art.

title: What to Watch: Philip K. Dick on Film
description: The things that draw readers to the science-fiction novels of Philip K. Dick are the same ones that make them hard to adapt. Here are five projects that captured his strange worlds.

title: After the Tornadoes, Small Towns Grieve for Lost Lives and Wrecked Homes
description: OHATCHEE, Ala.  The place where one home stood was nothing but cinder blocks and a bald patch of earth. The chicken coop had evaporated, leaving behind a pile of cracked eggs and a loose rooster. Metal siding was knotted around the trunks of trees and the grass was littered with splintered wood, clothes and toys.

title: How to Protect Massage Workers
description: The shootings of Asian massage workers in Georgia this month have been framed as part of a surge of anti-Asian violence during the Covid-19 pandemic. But theyre also part of a longstanding problem: the violence against and the surveillance of migrant massage workers.

title: Georgia G.O.P. Fires Opening Shot in Fight to Limit Voting
description: The fight over voting rights is emerging as one of the defining conflicts of the Biden era, and Georgia fired the opening shot with a set of new restrictions underscoring the political, legal and financial clashes that will influence whether Republicans retake Congress and the White House.

title: Stop the Executions, President Biden
description: When Virginia abolished the death penalty this week, much of the response focused on what was new: the first Southern state to take this step, the state that has executed more people than any other in American history.

title: No Small Favor
description: SATURDAY PUZZLE  Cripes, this is one of those grids that makes me seriously consider chucking it all, finding a nice scaffolding and a sea sponge and meditatively cleaning walls for a few months in the sunshine. Although, that suns probably beating down pretty hard, and to restore archaeological treasures I probably need at least one advanced degree  so, crosswords it is.

title: The E.U. approves more vaccine production sites amid lagging inoculation efforts.
description: The European Unions stumbling Covid-19 vaccination drive, badly shaken by the recent AstraZeneca safety scare, got a boost Friday from the European Medicines Agency, which approved new AstraZeneca, Pfizer-BioNTech and Moderna vaccine production sites.

title: Corrections: March 27, 2021
description: An article on Thursday about the Israeli election misstated the turnout. It was 67.4 percent, not 66.7 percent.

title: Modis Visit to Bangladesh Sets Off Violent Protests
description: DHAKA, Bangladesh  At least four people were killed and dozens injured in violent protests in Bangladesh on Friday, set off by the arrival of Prime Minister Narendra Modi of India to mark 50 years since Bangladesh gained independence.

title: For Michigans Players, Activism Has Been Seasons Theme
description: After No. 6 seed Michigan made its first round of 16 in the N.C.A.A. womens basketball tournament, an emotional reaction by the all-American forward Naz Hillmon offered a window into a season that has been about much more than winning for the team.

title: Expecting N.C.A.A. Miracles, the Oral Roberts Golden Eagles Make a Run
description: INDIANAPOLIS  This is the point, the second weekend of the N.C.A.A. mens basketball tournament, when the side door is opened and uninvited guests are unceremoniously ushered out. So the time is nigh to introduce the Oral Roberts basketball team.

title: Charli Collier of Texas Honors Her Fathers Memory With Resilience
description: Charli Collier has spent her last season in college basketball adjusting to a new coach, to a coronavirus-safe form of training, to disrupted classes and to conferring with her teammates over video calls. All the while, she coped with the expectation that she would become the top pick in the next W.N.B.A. draft.

title: 2 Killed, One of Them by Police, in Chaotic Night in Virginia Beach
description: A police officer fatally shot a man in an encounter that capped a chaotic night of violence on Friday in Virginia Beach, where a woman was also killed by stray gunfire, the authorities said.

title: Children Trapped by Colombias War, Five Years After Peace Deal
description: PUERTO CACHICAMO, Colombia  At 13, she left home to join the guerrillas. Now, at 15, Yeimi Sofa Vega lay in a coffin, killed during a military operation ordered by her government.

title: Quotation of the Day: Children Trapped in Crossfire as War Drags On in Colombia
description: If we dont create change, if there is no investment, no other vision for our sons and daughters, we are going to fill our cemeteries with children.

title: She Vanished Decades Ago. Her Children Just Learned She Had Been Killed.
description: One day, about a half-century ago, William Heiser Jr. came home from boarding school to find that his mother was gone. His father, William Sr., a former police officer, told him and his sister that their mother had walked out.

title: A Downtown Gallerist Spreads His Wings
description: Name: Alexander Shulan

title: So, Whats Your Fauxmorbidity?
description: After Covid-19 vaccines from Pfizer and Moderna were approved for use in late 2020, anecdotes proliferated about rich people finding ways to jump the distribution priority line.

title: Google Aims to Be the Anti-Amazon of E-Commerce. It Has a Long Way to Go.
description: OAKLAND, Calif.  Google tried to copy Amazons playbook to become the shopping hub of the internet, with little success. Now it is trying something different: the anti-Amazon strategy.

title: As Pandemic Upends Teaching, Fewer Students Want to Pursue It
description: Kianna Ameni-Melvins parents used to tell her that there wasnt much money to be made in education. But it was easy enough for her to tune them out as she enrolled in an education studies program, with her mind set on teaching high school special education.

title: For Them, New York City Will Never Be the Same
description: The old job, the old office, the old week  for many New Yorkers, the possibility of the return of something resembling their old life appears finally within reach. For them, the year of the pandemic was a blip, a pause, however frustrating, in their lives.

title: What the Media Has Learned Since Columbine
description: Last week, the CNN anchor Brianna Keilar found herself, for the second time in under a week, guiding viewers through the grim ritual of trying, and failing, to make sense of another mass shooting.

title: In Washington, Policy Revolves Around Joe Manchin. He Likes It That Way.
description: WASHINGTON  If Democrats eliminate the filibuster, there is one senator who would have an outsized impact in the 50-50 chamber on issues that could reshape the nations future: infrastructure, immigration, gun laws and voting rights. That senator is Joe Manchin III of West Virginia.

title: Can New Gun Violence Research Find a Path Around the Political Stalemate?
description: WASHINGTON  Dr. Bindi J. Naik-Mathuria, a pediatric trauma surgeon at Texas Childrens Hospital who grew tired of seeing toddlers die of gunshot wounds, has a $684,000 federal grant to track every gun-related death and injury in Houston. The goal: identify and address hot spots the way epidemiologists track and contain the coronavirus.

title: We Want Our Friends Back! (But Which Ones?)
description: Its not like 2020 was a year without friends. We raised a toast on Zoom birthday parties, organized trivia nights on Google Meet and spent more time than ever waiting in lines, a great place to make new friends.

title: Was Keeping Tourists Out the Only Way to Survive?
description: ST. MARY, Mont.  In a regular spring season at Johnsons of St. Mary, the R. V.s would be pulling into the more than 150 sites with sweeping views of Glacier National Park. Campsites would start filling up. The kitchen would start churning out homemade soup and bread.

title: Skiing in Himalayas Is Like a Beautiful Dream, Despite Conflict and Coronavirus
description: GULMARG, Kashmir  As a soft snowfall blanketed everything around her, Nihad Ashraf Khan, a college student who had been cooped up for months because of the pandemic, ran up to her attic and almost frantically grabbed for her skis, poles, boots and goggles  and headed immediately for the Himalayas.

title: A Collapse Foretold: How Brazils Covid-19 Outbreak Overwhelmed Hospitals
description: PORTO ALEGRE, Brazil  The patients began arriving at hospitals in Porto Alegre far sicker and younger than before. Funeral homes were experiencing a steady uptick in business, while exhausted doctors and nurses pleaded in February for a lockdown to save lives.

title: Cant Take the Heat? A Taste for Spicy Foods Can Be Learned.
description: The sauces on the table remain untouched  plain is fine, thank you.

title: Indias News Upstarts Challenged Modi. New Rules Could Tame Them.
description: NEW DELHI  Narendra Modi, Indias prime minister, has cultivated and cowed large parts of the countrys normally raucous news media in recent years as part of a broader campaign against dissent.

title: China, With $400 Billion Iran Deal, Could Deepen Influence in Mideast
description: China agreed to invest $400 billion in Iran over 25 years in exchange for a steady supply of oil to fuel its growing economy under a sweeping economic and security agreement signed on Saturday.

title: Sharon Osbourne Leaves The Talk, CBS Says
description: Sharon Osbourne, a television host who faced criticism for defending contentious remarks by the British journalist Piers Morgan about Meghan, the Duchess of Sussex, has decided to leave The Talk, the U.S. daytime talk show where she worked for more than a decade, CBS said on Friday.

title: Wall Streets Sleepless Nights
description: The DealBook newsletter delves into a single topic or theme every weekend, providing reporting and analysis that offers a better understanding of an important issue in the news. If you dont already receive the daily newsletter, sign up here.

title: Why the internet loves the Suez Canal stuck ship saga.
description: Its a moment that has managed to wrap Bernie Sanderss mittens, jokes about poor driving skills and timeless office humor into one.

title: Dozens Are Gunned Down in Day of Shame for Myanmar
description: On the eve of a major military celebration, Myanmars army warned people not to come out to protest or they could be shot in the back, or in the head.

title: Under Biden, Diplomacy Is an Attractive Career Again
description: WASHINGTON  When Aaron Luce quit the Foreign Service in 2019, President Donald J. Trump loomed large in his mind.

title: Easy to get, hard to repay: Predatory loans flourish in pandemic-gripped India.
description: These lenders dont require credit scores or visits to a bank. But they charge high costs over a brief period. They also require access to a borrowers phone, siphoning up contacts, photos, text messages, even battery percentage.

title: The go-to vaccine outfit? Dolly Parton set the style with a cold-shoulder top.
description: Look out, Zoom shirt. Here comes the vaccine top.

title: After a year of the pandemic, public transit around the world is hanging by a thread.
description: In London, Piccadilly Circus station is nearly empty on a weekday morning, while in Delhi, the Metro ferries fewer than half of the riders it used to. In Rio, bus drivers are on strike, and in New York City, subway traffic is at just a third of normal volume.

title: Learning to Connect With My Male Friends
description: I was 20 when I learned that my parents were splitting up.

title: Love Letter: Divorce Rates Are Down, for Now.
description: If the pandemic has done one good thing, its given some couples the opportunity to work through their differences. In many states across the country, divorce rates have dropped considerably in the past year. Some divorce lawyers and relationship experts credit uncertainty, financial concerns and more time spent together as a few of the reasons couples arent calling it quits.

title: Should Only Vaccinated People Be Allowed to Use the Gym?
description: Q: My co-ops gym has been closed since last March. The board recently decided to reopen the gym for those shareholders who are fully vaccinated against Covid-19. All others are still prohibited from using the gym. Is this legal?

title: Treat Yourself
description: Todays as good a day as any to treat yourself to Melissa Clarks lemon pudding cakes with sugared raspberries (above). The batter is simple, yet it yields two distinct textures  spongy cake on top and custardy pudding on the bottom. That complexity may be why it was the most popular recipe this week. And if youre looking for an entree to go with that dessert, try Susan Spungens vegetarian whole roasted cauliflower with pistachio pesto, Von Diazs pollo en fricas (from her collection of essential Puerto Rican recipes) or another savory dish from our list of the 10 most popular NYT Cooking recipes this week.

title: Eurovision Song Contest Disqualifies Belarus Over Political Lyrics
description: The long-running unrest in Belarus has spilled over into this years Eurovision Song Contest, with organizers ejecting the country from the competition for songs found to have repeatedly violated rules barring political content.

title: A Very Big Problem. Giant Ship in the Suez Remains Stuck.
description: [Update: After nearly a week, the Ever Given, the mammoth container ship stuck in the Suez Canal, has been freed.]

title: The Kind Workers at King Soopers Who Helped a Confused College Kid
description: To the Editor:

title: The Wealth of Ambassadors: Does It Matter?
description: To the Editor:

title: Just Give It a Go, Joe
description: WASHINGTON  Even though he doesnt drink, Joe Biden was always bubbly at the holiday parties he gave at the vice presidents residence. He would lean in to tell you a good story or give you his unvarnished opinion about other top officials.

title: Hes a Famous Evangelical Preacher, but His Kids Wish Hed Pipe Down
description: The Rev. Rick Joyner is a famous evangelical leader who has called on Christians to arm themselves for an inevitable civil war against liberals, who he suggests are allies of the devil.

title: The Middle-Class Women of Iran Are Disappearing
description: A few weeks after the Trump administration withdrew from the Iran nuclear deal in May 2018, Secretary of State Mike Pompeo condemned brutal men of the regime in Tehran for oppressing Iranian women who were demanding their rights.

title: They Were Guantnamos First Detainees. Heres Where They Are Now.
description: WASHINGTON  On Jan. 11, 2002, at the desolate air strip at Guantnamo Bay, United States Marines escorted 20 prisoners clad in orange uniforms from an Air Force cargo plane  the worst of the worst, the Pentagon called them  making them the first inmates of the wartime detention center that remains open to this day.

title: The Original 20 Guantnamo Detainees: A Roster, and Where They Are Now
description: Mr. Ali, a Pakistani citizen, was among the earliest people repatriated from Guantnamo Bay, Cuba, at a time when the main prison facility, Camp Delta, held 680 detainees. The journalist Mark Bowden wrote that he traveled to Pakistan to meet some former Guantnamo prisoners and found Mr. Ali and another detainee, who said they had not been abused in American custody except for some roughing up immediately after they were captured. Both were in their 20s, he wrote in a later account, from tiny villages in the mountainous region of Pakistan where Al Qaeda and the Taliban hid, and he described them as hapless young Pakistanis who were rounded up by Afghani warlords for a bounty of $4,000 a head.

title: Under Biden, Democrats Are Poised to Raise Taxes on Business and the Rich
description: WASHINGTON  Democrats have spent the last several years clamoring to raise taxes on corporations and the rich, seeing that as a necessary antidote to widening economic inequality and a rebuke of President Donald J. Trumps signature tax cuts.

title: Argentina delays second doses to focus on broader vaccinations with first dose, fearing a variant-fueled wave.
description: BUENOS AIRES  Argentina is delaying the administration of the second dose of Covid-19 vaccines for three months in an effort to ensure that as many people as possible get at least one dose amid a sluggish vaccination drive.

title: Variety: Acrostic
description: ACROSTIC  Todays excerpt is one for my , or soul, because I am a great fan () and scholar () of its subject: the emoji. Im fond of texting over calling and good-natured, illustrative imagery over, um, punctuation, and I welcome the emojis creep into professional life, as appalling as that might sound to some. (I hope I didnt just give the whole puzzle away, especially if youre still stuck thinking those two words with J second-to-last could be banjos.)

title: Glynn S. Lunney Dies at 84; Oversaw NASA Flights From Mission Control
description: Glynn S. Lunney, the NASA flight director who played a major role in Americas space program and was hailed for his leadership in the rescue of three Apollo 13 astronauts when their spacecraft was rocked by an explosion en route to the moon in 1970, died on March 19 at his home in Clear Lake, Texas. He was 84.

title: Suicide and Self-Harm: Bereaved Families Count the Costs of Lockdowns
description: LONDON  Sunny, driven and with a new engineering masters degree in hand, Joshua Morgan was hopeful he could find a job despite the pandemic, move out of his mothers house and begin his life.

title: Serbia Hails Chinese Companies as Saviors, but Locals Chafe at Costs
description: METOVNICA, Serbia  The well in the retired couples yard, their only source of clean water, began to dry up two years ago. Last year, dead fish started washing up on the banks of the river that runs by their home in a bucolic village in southeastern Serbia.

title: Vessels Accumulate as Cargo Ship Remains Lodged in Suez Canal
description: The Ever Given container ship on Saturday remained lodged in the Suez Canal in Egypt, where it had been stuck since Tuesday. Authorities said the jam has caused a backlog of more than 300 ships waiting to cross.

title: How Does a Baby Bust End?
description: The declining American birthrate is a frequent preoccupation of this column, and over the years that Ive been writing about the problem its only gotten worse, with the apparent Covid-19 baby bust a punctuation mark.

title: Stop It With Gun Control. Enough Already.
description: The words tumbled readily from Josh Hawleys lips as he argued for doing little in the wake of the Atlanta and Boulder, Colo., massacres.

title: Bidens Chance to Save the Everglades
description: With passage of the Covid-19 relief bill behind it, the Biden administration will soon offer its encore, one or more big proposals reflecting President Bidens multitrillion-dollar Build Back Better, which will enlarge governments role in the American economy. Together, these budget requests will be bigger in dollar terms than the relief bill, will address daunting problems like infrastructure and climate change  and, inevitably, will revive the partisan divide that plagues Washington.

title: An Immigrant Family Caught Up in a Distinctly American Tragedy
description: ARVADA, Colo.  Two decades after they left Syria for a new home in the Rocky Mountains, it looked from the outside as if the Alissa family had made it in America.

title: Images From a Deadly Weekend of Protests in Myanmar
description: In a weekend of carnage, Myanmar security forces killed protesters in more than 40 cities and towns as the military regime that seized power two months ago sought to put down opposition to its rule.

title: A third of U.S. adults have received first doses, but New York and Arkansas lag in giving all adults vaccine access.
description: The U.S. vaccination campaign is accelerating rapidly, with more than 91 million people  roughly a third of the adult population  having received at least one shot of a Covid-19 vaccination by Saturday. And nearly every state has announced that it will meet President Bidens directive to make all adults eligible by May 1.

title: State lawmakers take aim at the emergency powers governors have relied on in the pandemic.
description: When the pandemic began, the nations governors suited up for a new role as state bodyguards, issuing emergency orders to shutter schools, close cinemas and ban indoor dining in an effort to curb a mushrooming threat.

title: Swiss Billionaire Joins the Bidding for Tribune Publishing
description: An octogenarian Swiss billionaire who makes his home in Wyoming and has donated hundreds of millions to environmental causes is a surprise new player in the bidding for Tribune Publishing, the major newspaper chain that until recently seemed destined to end up in the hands of a New York hedge fund.

title: A district judge in Texas rules that Austin can keep its mask mandate for now.
description: A district judge in Texas has allowed Austin and the surrounding Travis County to keep requiring masks, weeks after Gov. Greg Abbott ended the states mask mandate.

title: At Least 10 Killed in Protests Against Modis Visit to Bangladesh
description: DHAKA, Bangladesh  At least 10 people were killed and dozens injured in protests against a visit by Prime Minister Narendra Modi of India to Bangladesh as part of celebrations for the countrys 50th anniversary.

title: Indiana Upsets No. 1 Seed North Carolina State at N.C.A.A. Tournament
description: SAN ANTONIO  Indiana knocked top-seeded North Carolina State out of the N.C.A.A. womens tournament on Saturday in the round of 16, 73-70, making the Wolfpack the first No. 1 seed to fall from the field.

title: Mother of 6 Fatally Shot in Road Rage Episode, Police Say
description: A mother of six children was fatally shot in North Carolina during a case of road rage on Thursday as the woman and her husband were on a getaway trip, the authorities said.

title: Indias case surge hits highs not seen in months as festival season begins.
description: India, racing to contain a second wave of the coronavirus, on Sunday reported its biggest single-day spike since October  62,258 cases in the past 24 hours.

title: Howard Schnellenberger, College Coach Who Built Winners, Dies at 87
description: Howard Schnellenberger, who built the offense for the 1972 Miami Dolphins unbeaten Super Bowl champions, then revived downtrodden football programs as head coach at the Universities of Miami and Louisville, died on Saturday. He was 87.

title: Yankees Voit Out for a Month With Knee Injury
description: Luke Voit, the Yankees first baseman and the major-league home run champion last season, will miss at least the first month of the season to have knee surgery.

title: Craig muMs Grant, Actor and Slam Poet, Dies at 52
description: Craig muMs Grants biggest success as an actor was the role of Poet on the HBO prison drama Oz, but fans of that series were accustomed to seeing him credited simply as muMs. It was a name he adopted as a young man when he was exploring rap and slam poetry, influences that he said changed his life.

title: Baylor Passes Biggest Test of Mens Tournament; Oral Roberts Falters
description: INDIANAPOLIS  This mens college basketball season featured an early-season delight for the sports aficionados, a neutral site matchup of the teams that prognosticators tabbed as the best in the country  the highflying Gonzaga Bulldogs against the slick but dogged Baylor Bears.

title: Racist Moments in WWE Catalog Vanish in Move to Streaming Platform
description: Fans of the WWE Network have seen and heard racist tropes in the ring for years.

title: Over the Moon
description: SUNDAY PUZZLE  My impulse is to put a bright, happy photo on a column about a bright, happy puzzle, but that windblown little terrier in the gloaming seems a good choice today (although technically its the backdrop thats more relevant). This poetic grid, our fourth Sunday from Olivia Mitra Framke, takes flight from its title, a common expression, and gives us a twist that will appeal to all of the night owls, werewolves and Olivia Mitra Framke fans. (I am two for three, but feel free to aroooooo.)

title: Jimmy Gamonet de los Heros Dies at 63; Helped Ballet in Miami
description: This obituary is part of a series about people who have died in the coronavirus pandemic. Read about others here.

title: Dozens Killed in One of Myanmars Deadliest Days Since February Coup
description: Children and bystanders were among the dozens shot and killed in Myanmar on Saturday as the security forces cracked down on protests against the February military coup. On the same day, a parade honored the army.

title: Insurgents Seize Mozambique Town, Killing Several People; Fate of Hundreds Unknown
description: JOHANNESBURG, South Africa  Insurgents seized control of much of a town in Mozambique on Saturday, after a three-day siege that has left at least several people dead and hundreds of other civilians unaccounted for as government forces try to regain control, according to private security contractors in East Africa and news reports.

title: Many U.S. graduations are curtailed again, but some commencements will go on without guests.
description: Yale plans to hold a version of in-person graduation for the class of 2021 in May  with no guests allowed. Harvard is not even calling its commencement a commencement. It plans to hold virtual degree-granting ceremonies and, for the second year in a row, will postpone traditional festivities.

title: Inmate Is Killed in Hostage Standoff at Oklahoma Jail
description: An inmate was killed and a correction officer was injured after being taken hostage at the Oklahoma County Detention Center in Oklahoma City on Saturday, law enforcement officials said.

title: Take a Drawing Class and Celebrate Easter With the White House
description: Here is a sampling of the weeks events and how to tune in (all times are Eastern). Note that events are subject to change after publication.

title: Start Retraining for Social Interactions
description: As the days grow warmer and vaccination shots reach more arms, you may be looking ahead to getting out and about. An Axios-Ipsos poll released this month found that the number of Americans engaging in social interactions outside the home is increasing. And the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention recently issued new recommendations that individuals who have been vaccinated against the coronavirus can start to gather in small groups, without masks, offering a measure of hope in particular to those who have missed the intimacy of double dates and dinner parties.

title: Brighten Up Easter With Naturally Dyed Eggs
description: Egg decorating is a festive activity that celebrates the arrival of spring, a season of renewal. The egg, an ancient symbol of rebirth and new life, has a long and storied history tied to holidays and seasonal celebrations around the world, including Easter. In fact, if youve hand-dyed eggs, then you have, perhaps unknowingly, participated in one of the oldest known decorative art forms. In 2010, archaeologists in South Africa discovered engraved ostrich eggs dating back around 60,000 years. Since then, eggs have been decorated in every way imaginable, including traditional pysanky (Ukrainian Easter egg decoration) and arts-and-craft inspired decoupage eggs.

title: How to Save at the Grocery Store
description: How do you spend the right amount on food?

title: At Mealtimes, Consider a Return to the Table
description: If you have found yourself over the past year increasingly eating dinner in front of the TV, or scrolling endlessly through your phone over breakfast, you certainly are not alone.

title: Reclaim Your Groove With an Online Concert
description: The performing arts have endured a year like no other, but the decimation of touring and in-person shows has in no way squelched music fans love of a live performance. And in many ways, the pandemic has yielded creative new ways for artists to engage with their listeners.

title: Find a Headline, Write a Poem
description: Celebration and honor are two touchstones of the poetic tradition. With Aprils National Poetry Month approaching, lets write a poem in honor of another poem, and another poet.

title: Quotation of the Day: Under Biden, Foreign Diplomacy Has Become a Coveted Career Again
description: I think there is a sense that America is back.

title: Explosion Rocks Indonesian Church Compound on Palm Sunday
description: An explosion shook a Roman Catholic cathedral compound in the eastern Indonesian city of Makassar on Sunday morning, shattering the calm of Palm Sunday, a holy day for Christians.

title: Corrections: March 28, 2021
description: A picture caption with an article on Page 7 about digital interactions between Broadway stars and fans misidentifies the digital event attended by the Beetlejuice actor Alex Brightman. It was a birthday party that included actors from other shows, not a Beetlejuice event.

title: My Boyfriend and I Had Begun to Take Bike Rides Around Central Park
description: Dear Diary:

title: On S.N.L., Maya Rudolph Hosts a Unity Seder as Kamala Harris
description: This weekend, Saturday Night Live added one more question to the four that are customarily asked at a Passover Seder: Why wasnt this sketch chosen as the cold open?

title: Inside the Battle Over George Floyd Square
description: The trial over George Floyds death is underway in Minneapolis. What to do with his memorial site has become a controversy of its own.

title: A Biblical Mystery and a Reporting Odyssey
description: Times Insider explains who we are and what we do, and delivers behind-the-scenes insights into how our journalism comes together.

title: Would the Pandemic Stop Paul Theroux From Traveling?
description: For six days, Paul Theroux, the famous American travel writer, dined on hard-boiled eggs, microwaved dal and wine.

title: His Plane Crashed in the Amazon. Then Came the Hard Part.
description: This story was produced in partnership with the Pulitzer Centers Rainforest Investigations Network.

title: The Swift Collapse of a Company Built on Debt
description: LONDON  The courthouse should have already been closed for the day.

title: Ten Months After George Floyds Death, Minneapolis Residents Are at War Over Policing
description: [Watch Live: Derek Chauvin on trial for George Floyds Death]

title: All Hands on Deck: When Vaccinating Black People Is a Communal Effort
description: PANOLA, Ala.  The dog-eared trailer that serves as the only convenience store within 20 miles of this blink-and-you-miss-it rural hamlet, population 144, is more than a place to stock up on lifes essentials. These days the store  or more precisely its proprietor, Dorothy Oliver  has become an unofficial logistics hub for African-American residents seeking the coronavirus vaccine.

title: 16 Global Design Concepts for an Unpredictable Future
description: If anything, they are finding inspiration in global upheaval. From hundreds of possibilities, here are just a few examples we selected of projects begun or realized despite closed borders, disrupted supply chains and economic collapse.

title: After a Firefighters Death, His Son Gets a Truck Birthday Parade
description: Matt Boney said a fire chief had grabbed him on Tuesday night as they prepared to pull the body of their fallen comrade, Jared Lloyd, from the rubble of an assisted living center in Rockland County, N.Y., where Mr. Lloyd had died trying to rescue residents from a fire hours earlier.

title: Vaccines, Suez Canal, Passover: Your Weekend Briefing
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: The Week in Business: A Big Win for Marijuana
description: Good morning and happy Passover. Heres what you need to know in business and tech news for the week ahead.  Charlotte Cowles

title: Whats Going On in This Picture? | March 29, 2021
Doc Severinsen Recalls High Notes, Low Notes and Everything in Between
description: Doc Severinsen hadnt been able to practice his trumpet in a couple of days, and by his own admission, it was making him irritable. Im getting a little bit antsy, he said one afternoon earlier this month.

title: Syria says it will ration fuel as the economic toll of the blockage grows.
description: The government of Syria has said that it will begin rationing the use of fuel after the closure of the Suez Canal delayed the delivery of a critical shipment of oil to the war-torn nation.

title: Homes That Sold for Around $750,000
description: Each week, our survey of recent residential sales in New York City and the surrounding region focuses on homes that sold around a certain price point, allowing you to compare single-family homes, condos and co-ops in different locales.

title: The Sunday Read: Rembrandt in the Blood
description: It was in the winter of 2016 that Jan Six, a Dutch art dealer based in Amsterdam, made a discovery that would upend his life. He was leafing through a Christies catalog when he spotted a painting featuring a young man wearing a dazed look, a lace collar and a proto-Led Zeppelin coif. Christies had labeled it a painting by one of Rembrandts followers, but Mr. Six knew it was by the Dutch master himself.

title: Russia Trumpets Vaccine Exports, While Quietly Importing Doses
description: MOSCOW  Russia has lauded with much fanfare the arrival of its homegrown vaccine, Sputnik V, in Latin America and Africa, and even in some countries in Europe, calling it a solution to shortages around the world.

title: Edward Jenner Pioneered Vaccination. Will His Museum Survive a Pandemic?
description: BERKELEY, England  It has been called the birthplace of modern vaccination.

title: At least 36 states give clergy vaccine priority, for the risks they face and the example they set.
description: At least 36 states have made some members of the clergy eligible for a vaccine before the rest of the population, according to a New York Times survey.

title: The Unstoppable Merry Clayton
description: In 1962, an excited 14-year-old Merry Clayton turned up for her first big recording session. After entering the storied Capitol Studios in Hollywood, she took her place among the other young women who had been called to sing backup for a Bobby Darin record. Soon after they started to sing their part of the song, however, Darin stopped the session cold.

title: What to Cook This Week
description: Good morning. Todays one of those days where it would be really nice to spend the whole day cooking: a big pot of beans for lunches next week; Cheddar beer bread rolls for dinner this evening; a carrot cake for dessert; deviled chicken thighs (above) for the meal, alongside this terrific new recipe for roasted broccoli glazed in butter and vinegar.

title: Journalist Cleared of Defamation Charge Revives Indias #MeToo
description: Priya Ramani, a journalist, on being cleared of wrongdoing in a defamation suit

title: Inside Myanmars Army: They See Protesters as Criminals
description: Capt. Tun Myat Aung leaned over the hot pavement in Yangon, Myanmars largest city, and picked up bullet casings. Nausea crept into his throat. The shells, he knew, meant that rifles had been used, real bullets fired at real people.

title: What You May Not Know About Those April Flowers
description: NASHVILLE  My favorite spring flower blooms along the leafless branches of the lowly serviceberry, a small tree with varieties native to every state except Hawaii. In the old days, the serviceberrys simple five-petaled blossoms heralded springtime itself.

title: A Country That Values Guns More Than Children
description: To the Editor:

title: Christian Social Justice, Redux
description: To the Editor:

title: In the U.S., cases tick upward again as variants spread and states lift restrictions.
description: After weeks of decline followed by a steady plateau, coronavirus cases are rising again in the United States. Deaths are still decreasing, but the country averaged 61,545 cases last week, 11 percent more than the average two weeks earlier.

title: Edith Prentiss, Fierce Voice for New Yorks Disabled, Dies at 69
description: Edith Prentiss, a fiery advocate for the disabled who fought to make the city she loved more navigable for everyone, died on March 16 at her home in the Washington Heights neighborhood of Manhattan. She was 69.

title: How 2 Legislative Tacticians Scored Big Wins on Child Poverty in the Stimulus
description: WASHINGTON  As President Biden stood in the Rose Garden this month, basking in the glow of his newly enacted $1.9 trillion stimulus package, he singled out two lawmakers who had been toiling away in relative obscurity on its key provisions for years.

title: Testing, One, Two. Fans Flock to an Experimental Indoor Rock Concert.
description: BARCELONA, Spain  Mireia Serret, a 21-year old student at the University of Barcelona, said that she was not a big fan of the band that played here on Saturday, nor does she normally like large crowds.

title: Texas Upsets Maryland for Spot in the Round of 8
description: SAN ANTONIO  Sixth-seeded Texas came back for a 64-61 win over No. 2 seed Maryland in a tight thriller that sent the Alamodome into a resounding roar, becoming the lowest seed of this years N.C.A.A. womens basketball tournament to make it to the round of 8.

title: When Tragedy Strikes, What Does Criticism Have to Offer?
description: To hear more audio stories from publishers like The New York Times, download Audm for iPhone or Android.

title: Your Monday Briefing
description: Saturday appeared to be the bloodiest day of protests since the Feb. 1 military coup.

title: Cases in Florida, a national Covid bellwether, are rising  especially among younger people.
description: Scientists view Florida  the state furthest along in lifting restrictions, reopening society and welcoming tourists  as a bellwether for the nation.

title: Billions (Yes, Billions) of Cicadas Soon to Emerge From Underground
description: A few months of quarantine during the coronavirus pandemic? Thats nothing for a swarm of cicadas that have been underground since 2004.

title: These N.B.A. Contenders Just Got Better
description: The N.B.A.s trade deadline on Thursday featured more than a dozen trades  some surprising, some not so much. Several players named Gary were traded (Trent Jr., Clark, Harris). Miami was the biggest winner, acquiring Victor Oladipo and, separately, Nemanja Bjelica.

title: Flooding in Nashville Kills at Least 4 as Water Keeps Rising
description: NASHVILLE  Unrelenting rainfall in Nashville turned roads to rapids, sweeping vehicles off the streets and drowning a motorist who was carried away, one of at least four people killed during a storm that continued to threaten the city on Sunday, the authorities said.

title: At Least 4 People Killed in Nashville Floods
description: Heavy rainfall on Saturday night that continued into Sunday morning flooded roads and neighborhoods, prompting dozens of rescues. Flash flood warnings were still in effect on Sunday for parts of Middle Tennessee.

title: An Online Museum Shows Life During Wartime
description: Blew him in half, absolutely in half.

title: In Montana, Bears and Wolves Become Part of the Culture Wars
description: HELENA, Mont.  In addition to its spectacular landscape of mountains, rivers and prairie, Montana, the third least densely populated state in the country, has long been known for something else  wildlife policies that have protected animals of all sorts, including ones like grizzly bears and gray wolves that are often seen as threats to humans and to farming and ranching.

title: In the Name of Love
description: MONDAY PUZZLE  Its always nice to see a familiar byline as we open our solving week, and this puzzle is by one of our veteran Monday constructors, Lynn Lempel.

title: As Gonzaga Dominates, U.C.L.A. Tops Alabama in an N.C.A.A. Thriller
description: INDIANAPOLIS  Joel Ayayi, a junior guard from Bordeaux, France, with a sly grin and a silky jumper, fancies himself as lenfant terrible of the Gonzaga mens basketball team.

title: Nike Sues Over Unauthorized Satan Shoes
description: Some workplaces encourage employees to donate blood as an act of charity. But six workers at MSCHF, a quirky company based in Brooklyn thats known for products like toaster-shaped bath bombs and rubber-chicken bongs, offered their blood for a new line of shoes.

title: Scholastic Halts Distribution of Book by Captain Underpants Author
description: A childrens graphic novel by the creator of the popular Captain Underpants series was pulled from circulation last week by its publisher, which said that it perpetuates passive racism.

title: As Militants Seize Mozambique Gas Hub, a Dash for Safety Turns Deadly
description: JOHANNESBURG  As gunshots rang out across a port town in northeastern Mozambique on Friday afternoon, nearly 200 people sheltering inside the Amarula Palma hotel confronted a devastating reality: The armed insurgents outside the hotels doors had all but taken control of the town and there was no one coming to save them any time soon.

title: On Hallowed Ground
description: MINNEAPOLIS  I arrived in Minneapolis on a rainy Saturday, the city quiet and still, in the calm before the storm. It is a city changed, scarred and shifted, in anticipation and apprehension.

title: Getting to Yes: A Nursing Homes Mission to Vaccinate Its Hesitant Staff
description: WASHINGTON  The Covid-19 vaccine had finally come to Forest Hills of D.C., a nursing home in a prosperous neighborhood of the nations capital, but there was a problem. Though nearly all of the homes residents agreed to get the shots, nearly half its 200 staff members declined.

title: U.S. Men Fail to Qualify for Olympic Soccer Tournament
description: The United States failed in its latest bid to qualify for the Olympic mens soccer tournament on Sunday, falling to Honduras, 2-1, in a regional qualifying tournament in Mexico. A goalkeeping blunder proved to be the difference this time, but the feeling  and the frustration  was all too familiar.

title: Inside Americas Most Interesting Magazine, and Medias Oddest Workplace
description: Last August, when the pandemic seemed endless, John R. MacArthur, the publisher of Harpers, asked his doctor about the virus.

title: Do You Think You Can Tell How a Neighborhood Voted Just by Looking Around?
description: An interactive, street-level tour of Americas full political landscape.

title: Is This Patriot Enough?: Asian-American Veteran Reveals Scars as He Calls Out Bias
description: As town meetings go, the discussion was fairly routine, meandering from what Memorial Day celebrations might look like in the second year of the coronavirus pandemic, to a federal grant application for bulletproof vests for police officers.

title: Tools to Protect Your Digital Privacy
description: This week Ive invited Thorin Klosowski, an editor at Wirecutter, to give us some advice covering our tracks online.

title: Word of the Day: vehement
Baseball Puts the Regular Back in Regular Season
description: To hear more audio stories from publishers like The New York Times, download Audm for iPhone or Android.

title: No Longer a Tigress, Amari Avery Will Try to Make Augusta Roar
description: Its been eight years since Amari Avery made her first splash  her word  in golf. A 2013 Netflix documentary on elite grade school golfers introduced an 8-year-old Avery cruising her Riverside, Calif., street on her bike, pink handlebar streamers blowing in the wind, as Notorious B.I.G.s Going Back to Cali blared in the background.

title: Hes the Ideal College Athlete. So Why Did He Quit?
description: There has never been another college athlete like Hunter Woodhall.

title: A Ballpark Half Full and Another Half Empty for All 30 Teams
description: In baseball these days, its all about perception and percentage. As the country stirs cautiously back to normal life, each ballpark comes with its own set of pandemic restrictions: 12 percent capacity at Fenway Park in Boston, 25 percent capacity at Marlins Park in Miami  even (gulp) 100 percent capacity for the opener at Globe Life Field in Arlington, Texas.

title: Quotation of the Day:
description: Most soldiers have never tasted democracy for their whole lives. They are still living in the dark.

title: Corrections: March 29, 2021
description: Because of an editing error, some of the photographs with a list on Sunday of the first 20 prisoners at Guantnamo Bay, Cuba, were misplaced. In the third column of that article, each prisoner photograph should have been placed with the name immediately above. Ridah bin Saleh al Yazidi, listed at the bottom of the column, was not shown in a photograph.

title: Oil Refinery in Indonesia Catches Fire, Prompting an Evacuation
description: JAKARTA, Indonesia  An oil refinery on the Indonesian island of Java caught fire early Monday, sending flames and smoke towering into the sky, seriously injuring six people and prompting an evacuation of nearly 1,000 nearby residents.

title: Czech Billionaire Is Among 5 Killed in Heli-Skiing Crash Near Alaska Glacier
description: Five people, including the Czech Republics richest man, were killed on a heli-skiing excursion on Saturday when their chopper crashed near a glacier in Alaska, officials said.

title: Your Monday Briefing
description: In what appeared to be the bloodiest day of protests since the Feb. 1 military coup, at least 90 people were gunned down by Myanmar security forces on Saturday, according to a rights group based in Myanmar and Thailand. Myanmar Now, a respected news site, reported that 114 people had been killed.

title: We pulled it off! After days of arduous labor, a ship is free, and salvagers are triumphant.
description: The mammoth cargo ship blocking the Suez Canal was wrenched from the shoreline and finally set free on Monday, raising hopes that one of the worlds most vital maritime routes would quickly rebound and limit the fallout of a disruption that had paralyzed billions of dollars in global trade.

title: Whats on TV This Week: Extinction  The Facts and Hysterical
description: Between network, cable and streaming, the modern television landscape is a vast one. Here are some of the shows, specials and movies coming to TV this week, March 29-April 4. Details and times are subject to change.

title: Amid Accusations of Rape and Misogyny, Australias Leader Demotes 2 Ministers
description: SYDNEY, Australia  Seeking to address rising anger over accusations of rape and misogyny against members of his government, Prime Minister Scott Morrison of Australia reshuffled his cabinet on Monday, demoting two ministers tied to separate scandals, but keeping them in senior positions.

title: Contentious Union Vote at Amazon Heads to a Count
description: SEATTLE  By the end of Monday, thousands of yellow envelopes mailed to a squat brick building in Birmingham, Ala., will hold the fate of one of the most closely watched union elections in recent history, one that could alter the shape of the labor movement and one of Americas largest employers.

title: Remote Work Is Here to Stay. Manhattan May Never Be the Same.
description: Spotifys headquarters in the United States fills 16 floors of 4 World Trade Center, a towering office building in Lower Manhattan that was the first to rise on the site of the 2001 terror attacks. Its offices will probably never be full again: Spotify has told employees they can work anywhere, even in another state.

title: Behind Closed Doors, the Difficulty and the Beauty of Pandemic Hospice Work
description: Hanane Saoui is used to death. Sudden deaths and slow deaths. Painful deaths and peaceful deaths.

title: Yang and Adams Clash, Councilman Exits: 5 Takeaways From N.Y.C. Mayors Race
description: For much of the 2021 New York City mayoral campaign, the major Democratic candidates have been polite and collegial, with few flash points of tension.

title: Lesson of the Day: Suez Canal Blocked After Giant Container Ship Gets Stuck
description: Featured Article: Suez Canal Blocked After Giant Container Ship Gets Stuck by Vivian Yee and Peter S. Goodman

title: Sen. Mazie Hirono Wonders How Some Republicans Live With Themselves
description: When they vote en masse to screw people over, its hard to be all warm and fuzzy  and Im not a warm and fuzzy person to begin with.

title: Whats Behind the Hispanic Vaccination Gap?
description: A New York Times analysis shows that the share of Hispanic people among those vaccinated continues to lag behind their share of the general population in every state analyzed.

title: Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez and Americas Most Liberal Generation
description: THE AOC GENERATIONHow Millennials Are Seizing Power and Rewriting the Rules of American PoliticsBy David Freedlander

title: Help Us Put on The Morning Newsletters First Event
description: The Morning newsletter will hold a live event for Times subscribers on April 15, and we want to hear from you! Please complete one or both of the following prompts, and we may feature your response as part of the event.

title: Would You Want to Be a Teacher Someday?
description: When you think about your future career, do you ever consider teaching? If so, what grade level or subject area appeals to you the most? Why?

title: Why Big Tech Should Fear Amy Klobuchar
description: Senator Amy Klobuchar is trying to hold big tech to account and in the process make antitrust cool again. She believes that, because of their size and power, companies like Facebook, Google and Twitter have become a dangerous threat to American democracy.

title: We Cant End the Pandemic Without Vaccinating Kids
description: The United States coronavirus vaccine rollout has finally hit its stride, with well over two million doses administered daily. Soon, vaccines will be available to all adults who want them.

title: How Arizona Won the Weed Legalization Race
description: PHOENIX  When Arizonans voted to legalize recreational cannabis in November, it seemed plausible that sales would begin sometime in the spring.

title: Weighing the Use of Growth Hormones for Children
description: An 8-year-old boy I know is small for his age, shorter and slighter than his friends, even smaller than his 5-year-old sister. Concerned about the increasing use and possible risks of growth hormone, I asked his mother if shed considered treating him with it. She replied, Not really. Hes built like his father, who was short and slight as a boy and didnt shoot up until college.

title: Your Pandemic Babys Coming Out Party
description: No one in Deena Al Mahbubas family has met her daughter, Aara. She was born at the end of 2019, extremely premature. By the time Aara left the hospital for her home outside Boston in mid-June, the world was already months into Covid-19 lockdowns. Ms. Mahbubas close relatives, along with her husbands, all live in Bangladesh. The couple moved from there in 2013.

title: A Tawdry Tale of Local Graft Becomes a China #MeToo Moment
description: The woman from a poor village was only 19 years old when she started a sexual relationship with a local police chief. Soon, she had trysts with other local leaders, including police and hospital officials.

title: New Jersey Will Expand Voting Rights, as Some States Limit Them
description: Months after a divisive presidential election pushed voting rights to the fore, the issue has become a key political battlefield.

title: From a Brooklyn Railroad Flat to a Three-Bedroom With Doors
description: For many years, Jen Brennemans two-bedroom railroad apartment in Greenpoint, Brooklyn, was just perfect. She moved into the space with her two young sons in 2015, after separating from their father.

title: An Alliance of Autocracies? China Wants to Lead a New World Order.
description: President Biden wants to forge an alliance of democracies. China wants to make clear that it has alliances of its own.

title: Not on Facebook? Youre Still Likely Being Fed Misinformation.
description: The plague of misinformation  false rumors about the legitimacy of the 2020 presidential election, the ineffectiveness of face masks and the safety of 5G, to name a few examples  is usually blamed on social media. But false and damaging information isnt just available online. Its also abundant in broadcast media, and as politicians debate whether or how to regulate technology companies, they should also consider creating systems to address the dangers implicit in allowing and enabling the spread of misinformation, wherever its published.

title: The Start-Up Enemies of Wall Street Are Booming
description: SAN FRANCISCO  In 2009, Shamir Karkal and several colleagues struggled to raise money for a banking start-up, Simple. Most of the 70 venture capital firms they met over the course of a year didnt see the point of the idea, he said. The few that did thought it would fail.

title: Joe Biden Did Not Appear to Be a Master of Disguise
description: Gail Collins: Bret, last fall we had a brief talk about filibusters and you said you didnt like the idea of getting rid of them.

title: In San Francisco, Turmoil Over Reopening Schools Turns a City Against Itself
description: SAN FRANCISCO  The pandemic has brought grinding frustrations for parents, educators and students across the country. But perhaps no place has matched San Francisco in its level of infighting, public outrage and halting efforts to reopen schools.

title: What Is Going On With China, Cotton and All of These Clothing Brands?
description: Last week, calls for the cancellation of H&M and other Western brands went out across Chinese social media as human rights campaigns collided with cotton sourcing and political gamesmanship. Heres what you need to know about whats going on and how it may affect everything from your T-shirts to your trench coats.

title: The Boarding-School Boom
description: Boarding school had never been in the cards for Landon Moore. In December, he was a senior at Bloomington High School in Illinois; he had always assumed that his father, the schools principal, would hand him his diploma when he graduated, as to his older brother before him.

title: Why Transgender Girls Are Suddenly the G.O.P.s Culture-War Focus
description: The last time Republicans in South Dakota made a serious push to bar transgender girls from school sports, in 2019, their bill was known only by its nondescript numerical title, Senate Bill 49. Its two main sponsors were men. And it died without ever getting out of committee, just 10 days after it was introduced.

title: Action Bronson, Eater by Trade, Finds a New Craving: Fitness
description: One Saturday morning last month, Action Bronson was on the water at 7, staring down one burly wave after the next. Paddling around on a bodyboard, he was at Skudin Surf at American Dream, a 1.5 million-gallon wave pool in the middle of a three-million-square-foot mall and entertainment complex  a little touch of Dubai in East Rutherford, N.J.

title: A Biologist, an Outlandish Stork and the Army of Women Trying to Save It
description: Life can change in an instant, as I experienced when I first laid my eyes on a tall and bizarrely striking bird known as the greater adjutant.

title: The U.S. is concerned about Chinas influence over a report on the pandemics origins.
description: The Biden administration has expressed concern over the Chinese governments role in drafting a forthcoming World Health Organization report about the source of the coronavirus pandemic.

title: How Manhattan Office Life Is Changing
description: [Want to get New York Today by email? Heres the sign-up.]

title: How Much Do You Know About Uzbekistan?
description: Can you find Uzbekistan on a map? What else do you know about this Central Asian nation with a population of 33 million people?

title: Theres just a sense of entitlement: Hawaiians worry about a flood of heedless tourists.
description: Palakiko Chandler took their little cousins to Nanakuli Beach on Oahu last weekend and noticed something they hadnt seen in a while: a parking lot full of rental cars. The tourists were back.

title: The Trial of Derek Chauvin
description: On the docket on Monday at a Minneapolis courthouse is the biggest police brutality case in the United States in three decades: the trial of Derek Chauvin, a white former police officer accused of killing George Floyd, a Black man, last May.

title: As crews worked to free the ship, the internet demanded they put it back.
description: The saying goes that all good things must come to an end. But when it was announced that the ship that was stuck in the Suez Canal for days had been set partially afloat again  and could possibly be freed before the end of the day on Monday  social media users lamented the news.

title: Navalny vs. Putin
description: Aleksei Navalny, the fiercest political opponent of Vladimir Putin, is in prison. He returned to Russia in January after recovering from a near-deadly poisoning in Siberia. After the police arrested him on charges that were widely seen as politically motivated, a wave of pro-Navalny protests swept the country.

title: The Rich Get Richer With Nets Signing of LaMarcus Aldridge
description: On Sunday, Nets guard Bruce Brown learned from a reporter on a post-practice video conference call that his team had added LaMarcus Aldridge, the seven-time All-Star center.

title: O Dunedin: Canada Will Have to Wait to See the Blue Jays
description: It has been 18 months since the Toronto Blue Jays played a game in Canada, and it is likely to be several more before the team can return to its home field at Rogers Centre.

title: The Very Short Saga of the Guess Bag That Looked Like a Telfar Bag
description: For decades product plagiarism has been seen as the price of success in the fashion world: Make a hit bag or a viral dress and someone (sometimes many someones) will unabashedly rip it off, often almost overnight.

title: Money is pouring into start-ups that are eager to upend Wall Street.
description: Thousands of financial technology start-ups are riding an investor frenzy driven by a growing realization that the industry is ripe for a tech makeover, writes Erin Griffith of The New York Times.

title: A chunk of world trade is stuck waiting for the Suez Canal to clear.
description: A journey from the Suez Canal in Egypt to Rotterdam, in the Netherlands  Europes largest port  typically takes about 11 days. Venturing south around Africas Cape of Good Hope adds at least 26 more days, according to Refinitiv, the financial data company.

title: The bidding for Tribune Publishing got a surprise twist.
description: A Swiss billionaire who has donated hundreds of millions to environmental causes is a surprise new player in the bidding for Tribune Publishing, the major newspaper chain that until recently seemed destined to end up in the hands of a New York hedge fund.

title: How a Big Bad Bet Whacked the Markets
description: Credit Suisse and Nomura Holdings warned this morning that they faced huge losses from a multibillion-dollar fire sale of stocks held by just one investment firm, Archegos Capital Management. Its the latest sign of the fragility of the global markets, and could spur more attention from regulators on the murky world of swaps and investor borrowing.

title: How to watch the Derek Chauvin trial.
description: The trial of Derek Chauvin in the death of George Floyd is unusual for many reasons: It is being livestreamed from Minneapolis, attendance is severely limited because of the coronavirus, and the publics interest in the case may make this one of the highest-profile trials in recent memory.

title: Paul Laubin, 88, Dies; Master of Making Oboes the Old-Fashioned Way
description: Paul Laubin, a revered oboe maker who was one of the few remaining woodwind artisans to build their instruments by hand  he made so few a year that customers might have had to wait a decade to play one  died on March 1 at his workshop in Peekskill, N.Y. He was 88.

title: Sarah Onyango Obama, Ex-Presidents Stepgrandmother, Dies at 99
description: Sarah Onyango Obama, the stepgrandmother of former President Barack Obama who grew up without formal education in rural Kenya and devoted many of her later years to philanthropic efforts to help young Kenyans find places in school, died on Monday in Kisumu, a city in the western part of the country. She was 99.

title: Biden will share the details of his infrastructure plan and a first look at his budget plans.
description: President Biden and his administration will lay out a sweeping array of proposals for increased federal spending this week, including the first look at his budget plans for the year and the details of his much-anticipated infrastructure plan.

title: Counting starts Tuesday in the vote on whether Amazon workers in Alabama will unionize.
description: By the end of Monday, thousands of yellow envelopes mailed to a squat brick building in Birmingham, Ala., will hold the fate of one of the most closely watched union elections in recent history, one that could alter the shape of the labor movement.

title: Water Shortages and Fires Loom After a Dry Winter
description: Good morning.

title: The Champions League Is Changing. Heres How It Will Work.
description: After more than a generation in its current form, the Champions League is remaking itself, and about to become an actual league for the first time.

title: HarperCollins to Buy Houghton Mifflins Trade Publishing Unit
description: HarperCollins, one of the five largest publishing companies in the United States, said on Monday that it had agreed to buy Houghton Mifflin Harcourt Books and Media, the trade publishing division of Houghton Mifflin Harcourt, for $349 million.

title: Meet the New U.C.L.A.: Plucky Underdog
description: INDIANAPOLIS  When Hep Cronin, a baseball scout for the Atlanta Braves, would pack up the car for a trip to hunt for prospects, he would sometimes bring his two young boys, Dan and Mick. In the stands, they would ask their father which player he was watching, but he wouldnt tell them.

title: Watch Live: Day 1 of the Derek Chauvin Trial
description: Watch live coverage of the trial of Derek Chauvin. Note: The video may include graphic images.

title: On the Scene at the Suez Canal
description: I was there over the weekend as authorities tried to pry the ship free. Heres what I saw.

title: The C.D.C. extends its moratorium on evictions until June 30 to ease hardships caused by the virus.
description: The Centers for Disease Control and Prevention has extended its nationwide moratorium on evictions through June 30, pushing it back from the end of March, when it had been scheduled to lapse.

title: The Creamiest Asparagus Pasta!
description: Good morning. Eric Kim has a lovely story in The Times this week about using seaweed to add subtle umami to dishes, as in this creamy asparagus pasta recipe (above) that tastes a little bit like shrimp Alfredo even though it contains no seafood. (You could always add shrimp, though. Thatd be excellent.) The shredded seaweed snack sprinkled on top is what does it, along with cooking the pasta in a quick version of the Korean stock known as dasima yuksu. Wont you give that recipe a try this week?

title: George Floyds family, the news media and protesters gather outside the courthouse.
description: A helicopter whirred overhead on a sunny, yet chilly and windy morning on Monday in downtown Minneapolis, where the streets were largely empty and calm ahead of the big trial.

title: Thank You, Dr. Zizmor
description: The newest fashion trend in New York is  unironically, hyper-specifically  New York itself.

title: What to know about Jerry W. Blackwell, the prosecutor making opening arguments.
description: The lawyer making opening arguments for the prosecution is Jerry W. Blackwell, a lawyer who has represented a series of large companies and joined the attorney generals office just for this case on a pro bono basis, meaning he will not be paid.

title: The Biden administration will investigate Trump-era attacks on science.
description: The Biden administration will investigate Trump-era political interference in science across the government, the first step in what White House officials described as a sweeping effort to rebuild a demoralized federal work force and prevent future abuses.

title: A majority of school districts are now open. But not everyone wants to return.
description: Elementary students returned to classrooms in Long Beach, Calif., on Monday and campuses from Los Angeles to Boston prepared for significant expansions of in-person instruction as a majority of the nations districts have now begun to reopen school buildings, many of which have been closed for more than a year.

title: Officials Missteps on Covid, Then and Now
description: To the Editor:

title: They Set Aside Money for Their Commutes. Now They Cant Get It Back.
description: Any bit of savings helped when Eileen Damore was spending more than $400 a month to travel by train and subway from her Long Island home to her job at a printing company in Manhattan.

title: Teenage Brains May Be Especially Vulnerable to Marijuana and Other Drugs
description: Adolescents and teenagers who experiment with marijuana and prescription drugs are more likely to get hooked on them than young people who try these drugs for the first time when they are college-aged or older, according to a new analysis of federal data.

title: My Pen Pal
description: Stories of very unusual pen pals, including a ten-year-old girl from Michigan who befriends Panamanian dictator Manuel Noriega.

title: The Moderna and Pfizer-BioNTech vaccines are very effective in real-world conditions at preventing infections, the C.D.C. reported.
description: The coronavirus vaccines made by Moderna and Pfizer-BioNTech are proving highly effective at preventing symptomatic and asymptomatic infections under real-world conditions, federal health researchers reported on Monday.

title: The Devils Went Down to Georgia
description: In the newest swing state, all of the Senate runoff candidates relied on Trump for one last turn out extravaganza.

title: Bidens Lesson From Past Green Stimulus Failures: Go Even Bigger
description: WASHINGTON  In September 2009, then-Vice President Joseph R. Biden Jr. traveled to a defunct General Motors plant near his hometown, Wilmington, Del., to announce a $528.7 million government loan for Fisker Automotive to make hybrid and electric vehicles.

title: What we know about Eric J. Nelson, the lawyer presenting opening arguments for Derek Chauvin.
description: Eric J. Nelson is one of a dozen defense lawyers in Minneapolis who work on a rotation basis to represent police officers charged with misconduct. Mr. Nelson, 46, took charge of the former police officer Derek Chauvins defense over the summer, after his first lawyer retired.

title: Squeaker
description: People grappling with an endless presidential election.

title: When Your Child Is a Psychopath
description: The condition has long been considered untreatable. Experts can spot it in a child as young as 3 or 4. But a new clinical approach offers hope.

title: In the Presence of George Floyd
description: To the Editor:

title: Drag Star Sasha Velour Lip-Syncs for Her Operatic Life
description: Opera is about sound bellowing from someones throat. Lip-syncing is the opposite. While opera lovers have long been known to silently join in with recordings in the privacy of their homes, can there be a true operatic performance based on mouthing along?

title: How Chinas Outrage Machine Kicked Up a Storm Over H&M
description: When the Swedish fast-fashion giant H&M said in September that it was ending its relationship with a Chinese supplier accused of using forced labor, a few Chinese social media accounts dedicated to the textile industry took note. But by and large, the moment passed without fanfare.

title: The case against Derek Chauvin will center on proving George Floyds cause of death.
description: With the central question of the case being exactly how Mr. Floyd died, and what role Mr. Chauvins actions played, the state indicated it would cast a much wider net than just relying on the autopsy report of the county medical examiner by bringing in a number of medical experts.

title: U.S. trade with Myanmar is suspended over killings by the military.
description: The Biden administration suspended a trade pact with Myanmar on Monday following one of the deadliest weekends in the country since the military ousted the civilian leadership and began a killing spree on civilians.

title: Darby Stanchfield Reads A Family That Takes No for an Answer
description: The Scandal actress reads Leigh Newmans story of a family hunting excursion that proves revelatory.

title: What we learned from the opening statements.
description: Before prosecutors called their first witness, lawyers for both sides made opening statements to jurors in the trial of Derek Chauvin, the former Minneapolis police officer charged with murder in George Floyds death. Heres what happened.

title: Could the Pandemic Spell the End of the U.K.s High-Speed Rail?
description: STEEPLE CLAYDON, England  A chorus of bird song gives way to the roar of a chain saw and then the creaking and splintering of timber. A 50-foot tree sways, wobbles and finally crashes to the ground, while protesters shout and jeer.

title: The first witness is a 911 dispatcher who called the police on the police as George Floyd was arrested.
description: The first witness to take the stand in the murder trial of Derek Chauvin on Monday was Jena Scurry, a 911 dispatcher in Minneapolis who alerted a police supervisor in May after she watched officers pin George Floyd to the ground live on a surveillance camera.

title: The Biden administration makes a swath of ocean between New York and New Jersey an offshore wind zone.
description: The Biden administration announced a plan on Monday to vastly expand the use of offshore wind power along the East Coast, aiming to tap a potentially huge source of renewable energy that has so far struggled to gain a foothold in the United States.

title: Lara Trump Joins Fox News as a Paid Contributor
description: Fox News just hired a Trump. But not Donald.

title: Justin Biebers Justice Debuts at No. 1, Ending Morgan Wallens Run
description: After 10 weeks of domination by the country singer-songwriter Morgan Wallen, the Billboard album chart has a fresh champion: Justin Bieber.

title: Sharpton and Crump warn that the world is watching as witnesses begin to testify.
description: The Rev. Al Sharpton and Ben Crump, a lawyer for George Floyds family, told supporters on Monday, just as witnesses began to give testimony during the trial, that the world was focused on the case of the former police officer Derek Chauvin in the death of Mr. Floyd.

title: Jack Bradley, Louis Armstrong Photographer and Devotee, Dies at 87
description: Jack Bradley, an ecstatic fan of Louis Armstrongs who became his personal photographer, creating an indelible and intimate record of the jazz giants last dozen years, died on March 21 in Brewster, Mass., on Cape Cod. He was 87.
